Review_Date: Kimmie K wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: The Riad Nafis staff took care of my husband and I from the moment we landed. We were anxious about visiting a new country and the put us at ease which made our short weekend very enjoyable. They arranged a taxi pick-up for us and met us in the street when our taxi arrived to walk us down the alley's to reach the Riad. This is a typical city with streets and signs that are easily read on a map so that was very helpful to us or we would have been lost immediately.  Check-in was very easy the room was comfortable well cleaned had soap shampoo and even hand towels ( which I forgot to pack this once).  They booked great excursions for us at reasonable prices. Even though there was a bit of a language barrier the man helping us was very patient and went out of his way to help however he could. We were glad they served breakfast here so we wouldn't have to wonder around for food in the morning. I enjoyed my first experience with Moroccan mint tea and now I love it.  The location can't be beat! I specifically picked this because of other reviews. It is about 7-10 min walk to the souks and restaurants. Depending on traffic it can be a 5-10 drive to/from airport and walking/pick up tours were easily done from here. Our stayed felt like we were welcomed into someone's cozy home and the staff really made our visit to Marrakech memorable!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jessica M wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Title: Beautiful riad and great price! I would stay here again and would recommend it to others.
Review_Text: All you could ever want in a Riad - good location helpful staff great price clean bathroom and bedroom great breakfast. The medina is crazy and this was perfect location because you're in the Medina but not in the center. I would recommend this Riad to others and I would stay here again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just got home from 3 wonderful nights here. Our room Beldi was beautiful and spotlessly clean I loved our walk in shower! The riad is situated right beside the royal palace so there are police everywhere which makes you feel very safe and this little gem is within less than 15 mins walk from Jemaa al Fna where all the excitement is.  We contacted the hotel before arrival as we were coming in the evening and requested dinner. They had a lovely man waiting to pick us up on arrival who served us an amazing tagine for dinner in their lovely relaxing dining room. The roof terrace was fantastic both for breakfast and just relaxing after an exhausting day haggling at the souks!!! All the staff made us feel incredibly welcome and Abdou was brilliant giving us great tips on what to see and do and how to get around.  Be aware the call to prayer starts at 5am so if you are a light sleeper maybe bring ear plugs. Personally it didn't bother me at all it only lasts a minute or so and I just fell straight back asleep in the amazing comfortable bed. Also I found the wifi really good and never an issue. We will definitely come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: FAB 4 Nights.. couldn't have been better
Review_Text: My stay here was more than perfect. The hospitality was second to none. I can not thank the staff there for welcoming us soo much.  Once you arrive you are greeted with a welcome drink a map and a full explanation of where everything is. If your like me and a bit tired cos of your journey then do write everything down because you will forget later üôà.  I can not fault anything with the staff or the riad. Once again thank you sooo much.  Notes...  This is a riad so please expect a little noise from families and children outside.. but this was minor only saying if you dont like noise AT ALL.  You will aslo hear the call to prayer every morning perfect time to ensure you dont miss your prayers.  There is no bodna/ lota so take a spare bottle or potty wipes.  Location...  Just ten minutes walk away from the main sqaure of jama el fna once out of hotel out of alleyways at the main archway point just turn left and walk straight you will see Koutibia mosque so walk towards that and hey presto your there. I spotted a KFC on route to where there is the main stand for all the Grand Taxi station.  Taxi to airport can be arranged via the hotel or just get a taxi and this is 70 DHS for a small taxi.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We felt so welcome as soon as we entered the Riad. Abdou was super lovely and took the time to show us a map and explain Marrakech. We were next door to the Kings palace and the security was high so we never felt unsafe walking to or from the Riad.  Highly recommend you eat breakfast each morning here we even had dinner twice during our stay because it was so good.  The souks and main square is no more than a 10-15 min walk (depending on the route you take).  During our stay we organised a hot air balloon ride and massage....incredible!  We could not be happier with our stay at Riad Nafis. The staff truly made our stay most memorable so kind and helpful.  Take up the offer of the airport pick up and drop off it's worth the money and you are taken straight to the entrance of the alley closest to the Riad where you are met by one of the staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Tim D wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: Riad Nafis is a nice and gentle place for some peace and quite. Abdou is a kind & honest bloke even with a pricing error he honoured the rate we paid with the promotion offer. Breakfast was great and if you want a true moroccan experience you should try this.    The place is via some side streets 15/20 mins from airport and next to the Kings palace. Security is very good there.    It is walking distance to the busy square and key sites.    I would recommend to give this riad a visit and you will only know yourself whether you have had a good time no matter which review you read. some pics attached...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michelle G wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Title: Staying here is a MUST if you're visiting Marrakech
Review_Text: I immediately felt welcome and comfortable when I entered the Riad. The Riad is located in an amazing location close enough to the important sites such as Jemaa el Fnaa but far away enough from the hussle and bussle. The Riad is also located in a very safe area and I never felt uncomfortable or weary.    Upon arrival Abdou showed us a map of Marrakech and explained where to go what to do and little tips here and there - I have never received such attention to detail service before this. Throughout the stay all the staff were incredibly helpful and accommodating and were always more than happy to help out and would do so with a smile. The Riad even has a booklet of excursion they can help you book so you're in good hands in regards to site seeing.    I have told all my friends and family about Riad Nafis and I would urge anyone to stay here as it will make your stay in Marrakech unbelievable. I can't wait to book my next trip back to Marrakech just so I can stay here again. If this review does not convince you to stay here I don't know what will.    My last tip is that you MUST try the food in the Riad at least once because Nayema is an incredible cook and you'll be sorry if you give it a miss.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My daughter and I stayed in this Riad in late May and it is an absolutely wonderful hotel. It is a bit hidden but within very easy walking distance to the main square. Aside from how nice the hotel is the staff made our entire stay. They were extremely gracious kind and were always available if we needed anything. The breakfast was also top notch - so happy to look forward to in the morning. I would absolutely give it 5 stars. I would also advise anyone to take their offer to arrange for pick up at the airport. Upon arrival Marrakech can be a bit disorienting and Riads are often located within twisting alleys in the old city. So I would recommend having them pick you up so that your transition to the city is made easier.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Thank you so much to all at Riad Nafis :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jamie S wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Title: Calm and beautiful riad with a beautiful rooftop garden
Review_Text: We initially booked in their sister riad but there was a technical problem which needed repair so they informed us ahead of time and offered to transfer us to Riad Nafis (or refund our booking). To make up for the changes they also offered to upgrade us to a better room. All these turned out to be such a good thing! Riad Nafis was calm very beautifully decorated and it has a very beautiful rooftop garden where we enjoyed breakfast every morning. The staff there was absolutely adorable!! When they knew that we were celebrating our wedding anniversary they baked delicious chocolate cakes and offered us mint tea to celebrate the occasion with us. We were extremely touched by they gesture. Will definitely stay here again during our next visit!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is clean and tidy we've been there for 3 days with their twin room which is located on the ground floor. Tried the dinner there which is good value but remember to let the staffs know you wanna have dinner there at least on the same day's morning. The hotel facilities is acceptable while the polite & helpful staffs are what made this hotel better than the others.  The location is about 10 minutes walk from the "square" and quite close to a few palaces and tome. Though the front door of the hotel is hard to find and lots of teenagers on the street give you "helpful guidance" which costs some.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Ramani R wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: My partner and I travelled to Marrakech for the first time last summer and stayed at this absolutely gorgeous Riad.    It was an oasis of tranquillity in what can be a hectic and during August an incredibly hot city. It is walking distance from the central square and hubbub but far out enough to feel you're not constantly in the thick of it.    What I particularly liked was its authenticity. It's a small riad of around 4 rooms with a small central pool and so with only a small number of guests you can really relax. Our room was beautiful and we had a lovely big bathroom. The Riad is so peaceful and after arriving back from a busy day of sight seeing it's such a pleasure to step into a calming and gorgeous smelling (spa aromas) place you can call 'home' for a few days. There is a great roof terrace and as there are so few guests we often had the place to ourselves with a fantastic view over Marrakech.    As mentioned in other reviews it is the staff who make it the ideal getaway. The manager was brilliant throughout and was constantly around and ready to be of assistance if we needed him. When we first arrived he took us to the roof terrace with tea and traditional pastries and showed us the map of the city. He then arranged for another member of staff to actually take us around the city which was a great touch as it allowed us to settle in a get our bearings.    Just a word of warning the Riad is also very close to the airport which we hadn't realised and unfortunately meant we got completely ripped off by our taxi driver.    Finally the breakfast we received each morning was perfect home baked bread traditional pancakes and an array of condiments with lovely coffee and fresh orange juice to wash it down and set you up for the day!    I would highly recommend Riad Nafis and will definitely return in the future!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Best hospitality we have ever experienced!
Review_Text: For sheer friendliness and hospitality the staff at the Riad Nafis are the best we have experienced in any hotel we have ever stayed in. They are genuinely passionate about delivering a great service and went beyond expectations to ensure we had a fantastic stay.    This started from the moment we booked when we received a personalised email thanking us for our booking and offering to assist with any questions or services we required. Despite arriving late in the evening we were welcomed at the hotel with mint tea and pastries and given a useful briefing on the location of the Riad and nearby attractions.    I had my 30th birthday during our stay and the staff prepared a delicious 4 course meal for us including an ice-cream birthday cake with my name on it which we shared with the staff and other guests it was so big! We had a wonderful evening and I can't imagine having that kind of experience in an anonymous hotel.    The Riad is close to the main square the Palaces and Tombs and other attractions but tucked away so that it is away from the main hustle and bustle of Marrakech. It is clean comfortable and in traditional Moroccan style.    If you want all-inclusive anonymous luxury removed from Morocco this place is not for you. If you want an authentic (but very comfortable) Moroccan stay with delicious food tea and hospitality we would highly recommend this place. In fact we are already thinking about coming back!

Review_Date: Sarah M wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: We spent two nights here. The rooms were clean well-appointed and charming. The staff was incredibly helpful and served a lovely breakfast each morning.  When there was a miscommunication about our room arrangements they went above and beyond to make things right.  I couldn't be more pleased with our time here!

Calm retreat in hectic Marrakech. Small and friendly place - especially the staff who are all lovely and very engaging. Rooms are all nicely laid out. You are next to the Royal palace so security is good too. Yet you are not far from Jamaa el Fna 5 to 10 minute walk. Breakfasts are good brought up to the roof top terrace if you like and why ever not?? You can also partake of an evening meal so long as you order it in advance preferably the day before and they will ask you what you want. The warm 'salad' as a starter is good and of course the tagine or tangier of whatever variety. The call to prayer at 5am can be a little loud but I could easily sleep through it and when not it was charming.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Laura I wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: Riad Nafis is in a really convenient location it's about 15 minutes from the main square from where you can access pretty much all other attractions. The walk is somewhat off-road (as in the path has been dug up) but actually quite easy to navigate once you get your bearings. It's about 15 minutes by car from the airport so really convenient.    The staff are incredibly friendly and can organise meals transfers and excursions if asked. We were given a really comprehensive introduction when we arrived which was very helpful.    Breakfast was excellent it felt very traditional and really sets you up for the day with a good sugar hit. Our room was very nice if a bit cold (the weather was quite poor so I doubt this is an issue in the summer). The bathroom was very nice and the room was very clean. Terrace is lovely and the view is stunning pool looks nice but we didn't get the chance to use it.    One bit of advice: you aren't provided a key/code to the front door when you arrive so when coming back you need to ring the doorbell or knock. This in itself isn't an issue however we were in the Nomad room which is a twin room downstairs and were woken up around 2 am when the doorbell rang. If you're a light sleeper I would suggest you pay more and choose a room upstairs.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Very nice little hotel - friendly staff
Review_Text: The riad is quite centrally located but still rather quiet. Rooms are nicely decorated and clean beds are good. I only has five rooms so it is very informal.    The best about the Riad is it's staff. They are all very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace and delicious.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Authentic Riad with super helpful staff
Review_Text: I stayed at this riad for 3 nights in January and I have nothing bad to say about it. The check in was anytime and breakfast could be arranged for anytime as well. Upon arrival a staff member took as aside provided a map of the medina and explained where everything was relative to the road and gave us tips on how much can fare should cost to different sites. The area is very secure due the the proximity to the royal palace. There is no tv in the room and no restaurant but at the price point that was minor because for me vacations are to be spent exploring new cities. There is an excellent restaurant at a nearby riad (villa des orangers).    The staff are understanding of English but are much more comfortable conversing in French or Arabic. It gave me the opportunity to practice my French. Distance to the airport is about 10k. The one difficulty with his riad is that it is located in the medina so transport will pick you up and drop you off at the medina gates and then there is a 5 minute walk through a labrynth like path to get to the front door. Everything within the medina is walking distance from the riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Hugh H wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: Excellent experience at the Nafis from airport pickup to checkout. The guys are very friendly and super helpful with any questions we had. Breakfast every morning was delightful and served at a time that was convenient. Nice walk to the souks taking in medina life. Despite a later flight we were allowed keep the room for most of the day which made a big difference. Overall top marks and would recommend to friends.

We stayed as a family with my wife 13 month daughter and myself. The staff were very pleasant and provided good advice. They gave us a complimentary dinner on arrival (we arrived quite late that night from London Gatwick). Breakfast was very good continental selection of items. It was laid out on the roof terrace.... which had amazing views over the nearby mountains. Its very close walking distance (10 minutes - we were slow with a pushchair!) to the djma el-fana square. The bathroom was basic but in a very traditional morrocan style - simple but very clean. There is a pool in the courtyard outside the rooms... so you have to be careful with walking young children. We had a great time and are looking forward to another visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Nice little riad with five rooms. It is located in the back streets and is difficult to find and unaccessible by car.  The best hint is go to the Royal residence. The riad is located 100 meters behind it. The pool is small and unheated. The best asset with this place is the roof terrace where breakfast is served at good days. It is also equipped with nice sunbeds.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Jon H wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: Cosy comfortable friendly - nothing is too much trouble from booking excursions to running out for fresh tomatoes for breakfast.  It's clean bathroom is good; bed is lovely and made every day.  Handy for Marrakech centre but still peaceful.  Their philosophy is it's your second home and they do their utmost to fulfil that. Can't fault it really: highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dylan L wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: There are no faults to this Riad I was warmly greeted by Abdu the room was clean and beautiful the shower was hot and had a great pressure the breakfast on the rooftop terrace was excellent. I would definitely classify this place as a luxury boutique Riad. It was a wonderful treat after an 8 day bicycle tour of Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: John R wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: This riad is just around the corner from the Royal Palace wall and is very secure with police and soldiers on every corner.  The riad is very comfortable with an indoor swimming pool and a rooftop terrace which I highly recommend as a place to enjoy breakfast in the sunshine. Very clean great attention to detail and evident desire to make guests' visit a great experience. Don't hesitate to stay here-you won't be disappointed!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Zeeshan M wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Title: Amazing Riad - must stay if first time in Marrakech.
Review_Text: This was our first trip to Marrakech and first time not staying in a proper hotel - Riad Nafis did not disappoint - conveniently located close to all main attractions in Marrakech (most within a 15 minute walk) - staff (specially Mohammed and Abdul Rehman) were extremely courteous and took care of all our needs including excursions and very useful tips. Abdul Rehman even went on his own and bought tickets on our behalf for our next day train trip to Casablanca to help us in avoiding any last minute rush - this is truly five star customer service and really made us enjoy our first trip thoroughly. Also special mention to Naima for her hospitality at breakfast. All in all amazing Riad would recommend for anyone to stay here and really made our trip very memorable. Homely with very friendly staff but luxurious as well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We are coming to the end of a 3 night stay at this Riad and have had a lovely lovely stay. The position is close to the main sites but very quiet away from the hustle and busle of the streets nearby.  The staff are excellent in all ways and provided helpful recommendations as to how we could best spend our time in this exotic city. Special mention must go to Naima as she cooked us the most delicious Morrocan meals which really felt like the very best of home cooking. We thoroughly recommend Riad Nafis.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Wonderful Stay with a Disappointing Ending
Review_Text: Riad Nafis is a lovely peaceful spot next to the palace wall. Because of this it is also very safe as there are numerous soldiers and guards up and down the ally that leads to the riad. We enjoyed our stay. Our room was comfortable and the breakfasts were delicious. They also arranged airport transfer for us which is good because the riad is very difficult to find.  The free wifi is not good. I had to sit in the bathroom to get a signal.  Unfortunately when we were departing (at 5 a.m. to catch a flight) their credit card machine suddenly didn't work. We had to run around to find a bank machine in the dark and take cash from my credit card (big added expense) and give them most of the Moroccan money we had left.  So by all means stay here and enjoy but make good and sure their credit card machine is working at the beginning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Just back from a week in Marrakesh staying at the fantastic Riad Nafis. What a place! Beautiful traditional Riad in an excellent location within minutes walking distance from all the main attractions gardens squares souks medina and palaces. The staff here are wonderful and you are made to feel as welcome in your own home with first class service and attention to detail. The breakfasts served on the rooftop terrace are amazing and nothing is too much trouble for the staff. Arrange your airport transfer direct with the Riad as it is tucked away behind the new Royal Palace and is a bit tricky for drivers who are not familiar with the area to find. If you are planning a trip to Marrakesh definitely consider staying here....you won't be disappointed!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Edmond A wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: It was an amazing stay the staff is so nice it felt like we were invited in their home. Ismail greeted us with a Moroccan tea and pastries and explained us our stay.    They offered one of the best clientele service I have ever seen.    The rooms are beautiful and really clean and authentic Moroccan decoration. The rooftop offers a nice view for sunsets and they offer to bring the breakfast on their terrace!    The location is good and really safe as there is military staff nearby since it is adjacent to the royal residence so don't be afraid if you come by night although it is shady ;). It is about 10 minutes walk to the place Djama el fna. However the riad was difficult to find as it was in interior streets we asked a guy to bring us by walk for a little tip. Signs would have been helpful.    The staff were kind enough to keep our luggages during our 4 days excursion and move them to their other riad upon our return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This Riad is in the heart of a busy medina on a walking disntsce from Djna El Fna and next to the Royal Palace Azzis and Ismael take care of you as if you were a family member wahtever you need they're there for you they even walk you to your cab on a daily basis!!! My first trip to Marrakech and Riad Nafis has been an excellent experience breakfast is also delicious! Really couldn't ask for more!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Beautiful riad away from it all
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at riad nafis end of September/early October and we found it to be a lovely quiet riad away from all of the hussle and bustle of busy Marrakech. The riad is in the old madina located very near to the Kings residence which was great because there were always plenty of guards around making the area feel safe. The staff at the riad were always very helpful and really nothing was to much trouble. They arranged two excursions for us going to the Atlas Mountains and I would definitely recommend these excursions as it is nice to get away from it all and see something completely different and meet some local people. If we come back to Marrakech we would not hesitate to stay at riad nafis and again in the sultana suite as it was very nice and very comfortable. Thank you to all the staff that we dealt with at nafis we appreciate all that you did.

Review_Title: Perfect Riad in the heart of Marrakesh!
Review_Text: We recently stayed with Riad Nafis for 5 nights on our first visit to Marrakesh and were immediately blown away by how beautiful the Riad was and its perfect location.  When we arrived at the airport we were met by a driver arranged by the Riad to take us there we were then met by Niema who was very welcoming kindly showed us around the Riad and served us Mint tea and homemade Moroccan treats on the gorgeous rooftop terrace. Niema spent some time with us pointing out our local sights and recommended things to see. The suite and entire Riad was beautiful extremely clean and well maintained and a perfect base for the week. The Riad is fantastically placed next to the Kings residence walking distance from the famous Jamaa El Fna and other sights including the Tombs Jewish quarter and both local palaces. We were served a continental buffet breakfast every morning on the rooftop. We had two evening meals at the Riad - the food was amazing & the best local dishes we ate in Marrakesh! All the staff were exceptional made us feel like part of the family and were always so kind professional and couldn't do more for you. With all the hussle and bussle of Marrakesh Riad Nafis was a fantastic quiet and peaceful retreat to return too. We were so sad to leave and are so very grateful to all the staff for making our first time in Marrakesh so special. Would recommend to anyone!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Elsa W wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: My friend and I spent one night in Riad Nafis after traveling throughout Morocco in a tour group. The riad is absolutely beautiful and incredibly clean. Hicham the general manager and his brother were so welcoming and hospitable. Hicham took the time to sit down with us and recommend sites in Marrakech as well as some tips about the city. The rooftop is great at night with the breeze and you can see the Koutoubia Mosque. I highly recommend eating dinner at the riad. It was by far the best meal we had in the week we were in Morocco.    Overall amazing place to stay. Highly recommend to anyone traveling to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Great end to a fab holiday
Review_Text: We stayed for 2 nights at riad nafis. The room was lovely and a fab pool but the best part of our stay was the staff who were so helpful and friendly they made exploring marrakech a whole lot easier by helping us get our bearings and even walking with us sometimes. Thanks for the great stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Robin R wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: Wonderful staff and quiet relaxing and pretty place made it a sanctuary to return to. It was convenient to all the places to visit. The rooftop terrace was a lovely place to breakfast and the pool was nice to cool off in
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have had an absolutely fantastic stay at Riad Nafis! Our room was beautifully decorated and the air conditioning was a life saver in the 40‚ÑÉ heat! Would definitely recommend the rooftop dinner we had a chicken and olive tajine which was delicious (to be honest it was better than the meal we had eaten in a high end restaurant the previous night.) The staff in the Riad were lovely right from welcoming us with milk and dates to the manager personally saying goodbye to us and making sure eveything was okay at 12.30pm - bearing in mind he had been at the Riad since the early morning when we asked him to book a final day excursion for us. Really fantastic service; we have been spoilt! Will definitely be returning!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Cristina B wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: It was a great to relax and chill after a day at the souks and Medina. The decor and food was amazing especially their tea. I usually don't like tea loved their tea.Thank you Hicham and staff who made our stay amazing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Mahmoud S wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: A home away from home!! Hesham and his brother Joed as well as the rest of the staff are AMAZING! They welcome you and take care of you like one of their own. The location is minutes walk from Jama al Fina the breakfast is great (and is set up for you at anytime of your pleasing) the pool is great the rooms terrace and overall look of this Riad is full of charm. My wife and I both loved our stay at this Riad! Will be recommending this place to all our friends family and fellow travelers. Thank you Hesham and Joed and the rest of the staff! You made our stay Marakesh wonderful!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was an unbelievable stay. The manager and the rest of the staff became like family and took care of every need. The place itself was gorgeous and we loved the private dinner on the rooftop terrace. Staying there was the highlight of our entire pro can trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed here for 4 nights in June with my friend and the accommodation was perfect.    Staff are very friendly always there to answer any queries and Hisham went through a map with us when we arrived to point out the main areas to visit and was happy to ring and book us a massage at a recommended spa when we asked.    The location is ideal it is down a narrow alley way which appears confusing at first but if you get the airport transfer with the riad they will meet you from the car and show you the way they then show you the best way to walk into the town centre which is just a couple of minutes. I felt safe throughout something I was concerned about as we are two 25 year old girls the riad is next to the Kings residence so security guards are placed along the walk to the riad    We stayed in the twin room which was very clean great shower with comfortable beds and good air conditioning which was a life saver in the 40 degree heat! The roof terrace is beautiful with sun loungers and seating areas in sun and shade good views. Breakfast is served up here which is lovely. Wifi worked well especially on the terrace. There is also a small pool on the ground floor it is very small but we enjoyed sitting on the side dipping our feet to cool off! On one day we felt like we wanted to relax by a pool as it was so hot and many hotels allow non residents to use the facilities we chose the Sofitel which cost around ¬£25 for the day.    Overall great stay would highly recommend for a short stay in Marrakech providing a peaceful cool haven away from the chaos of the town!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Great place! Good location (but a bit hard to find the first time around) and great staff (they really made the stay) - they were incredibly helpful and informative. Very pretty room and very comfortable. Lots of attention to detail. Beautiful rooftop patio and good wifi connectivity. I'd definitely stay here again.

Review_Title: Great, safe location with outstanding staff
Review_Text: Spent 4 days here at the end of May. It is beside the Palace so a very safe area due to security guards. Staff were excellent. We had the twin room which was spotlessly clean and the sheets were excellent quality. Lovely breakfast on the roof each morning and sun loungers with towels and a straw sun hat laid out on each one every day - nice touch.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Lovely Riad with wonderful staff. Room breakfast and evening meal were good. The pool although small was a pleasant and refreshing break from the bustle of the Medina. The roof terrace was a calm haven. Highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The staff (especially Hisham) was extremely accommodating and friendly; they truly go out of your way that you are 100% comfortable and have everything you need. On my first night they had a little party for the guests to celebrate the 5th year in a row of winning a TripAdvisor award which I could not attend. They saved the food (various salads) for me which I had the following day for dinner -- delicious. Finding the riad is a bit tricky as it's at the end of a dead-end ally in the middle of the old medina but this adds to the charm and privacy as it's secluded a bit from the busier/louder main streets. It's also next to the royal palace so I was never worried about my security as you have to walk past the royal guards on the way to the riad. Would stay here again no question!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Frans G wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: small riad with good and peronal service. Good food particularly dinner and brekafast. It is well located close to the Koutoubia and the royal palace. he place is quiet aprt from the nearby mosque witth the occasional prayers
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Robert S wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: Very small but just perfect. Great service. Breakfast on rooftop is amazing. Good location to the shopping square. Hotel complimentary Wi-Fi works very well throughout. Although no TV in room didn't miss it..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hicham Mohammed and Kamal made our stay at this incredible Riad such a wonderful experience. Located within walking distance of the main square this tranquil Riad cannot be recommended highly enough with a beautiful rooftop terrace and refreshing pool delicious breakfasts and the most hospitablefriendly staff I have ever experienced anywhere in the world.  Thank you so much for a wonderful trip we will definitely be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I have been staying in the Riad Nafis since the 12th May and leave tomorrow. The staff have made it a really enjoyable stay. They have been really attentive but unobtrusive.    Nothing is too much bother and things like meals are served when it suits you.    Breakfast is nice. We had dinner in the Riad and they asked us what we liked and that is what they made. The main course was a chicken tagine and was delicious.    The sun terrace and small pool are very comfortable as is the little lounge. If you want a nice relaxing place to stay with nice facilities and great staff check out Riad Nafis you will not be disappointed.    Derek H.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A hidden gem in the heart of the Medina
Review_Text: My friend and I stayed here for 4 nights and it was absolutely lovely (this riad was recommended to us by other friends that stayed here and loved it). The location is perfect- a 5 minute walk to the main square and the souks. It's a bit hidden away in maze-like walkways so do what we did and take pictures of front doors to guide you back on the first day as you will get lost! It is not a place that you would just stumble upon if walking around.    The room was clean nicely done up and there were a lot of nice Moroccan features (lanterns etc) to make you get a feel of Marrakech. The beds were comfortable the massive shower was hot and powerful and there was air-con in the room. I've never ever stayed in such a friendly place with such attentive staff and such a personal touch it was amazing! The manager even picked us up from our taxi and walked us to the riad at about 2am when we arrived then served us Moroccan tea and had a chat whilst checking us in (cars cannot drive right up to the riad so arrange an airport transfer with the hotel and they'll get you from door to door). He also escorted us to the nearest main street so we could get our bearings the next day. We were given a lovely breakfast on the roof terrace each morning and the staff were all very friendly always asking if we needed anything what our plans were and whether we'd had a nice time each day. There was also lots of advice on hand about the local area which was very useful.    The pool was an added bonus as a quick dip (be warned its pretty cold!) cooled us down after being out all day in the sun then the roof terrace with loungers towels and sun hats was a tranquil place to hang out and relax.    It is VERY reasonably priced and great value for money. We were so impressed by the service provided by the staff that we were recommending it to other tourists whilst we were still in Marrakech! Both my friend and I absolutely loved it at Riad Nafis we felt very safe staying here and highly recommend it to others thank you so much to all the staff for making our stay so wonderful!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Choi C wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: We thoroughly enjoyed our week at Riad Nafis - minutes away from the Medina but such a haven of quiet especially the wonderful rooftop area.    All the staff were friendly and more than happy to help in particular Hicham the manager who was always there to provide advice and help which was invaluable when my daughter lost her mobile phone in the Medina and we had to file a report at the police station.    Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Kim M wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Amazing service with a personal touch
Review_Text: Spent 4 nights in this wonderful Riad. The staff were welcoming and the service was outstanding! The Riad was very helpful in organising a taxi to and from the airport as well as a day trip to the Atlas Mountains. The rooftop terrace was a relaxing break from the bustle of the Medina. Definitely would go back! Thank you to Hicham and his team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Johnny M wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: An oasis of calm in a buzzing city
Review_Text: Had a short break here at the beginning of last month. Everything about the Nafis is wonderful - it's location the room the rooftop terrace the views the hospitality the tea and when we ate in the food and local wine. The service was fantastic and the staff couldn't have been more helpful - arranging transfers to and from the airport and excursions into the Atlas Mountains and to the coast at Essaouira. Marrakech is not a city where you get hassled any more in my opinion nor ripped off. One tip - always have plenty of cash as invariably you'll want to or feel obliged to make a purchase and in a place with credit card facilities. Morocco felt very safe warm and welcoming to this pair of travellers visiting for the first time in early Spring. The Nafis contributed much to that.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Natalie F wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: We stayed here for 3 nights and would highly recommend it! The staff were incredibly helpful booking train tickets organising taxis ringing the balloon company to confirm times& they also gave us lunch for our onward journey. The rooms were lovely the location was great only 5 minutes from the main square. We would definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This Riad was perfect. The location was nice the beds were comfy the food was great and the staff and manager were beyond accommodating. I travelled to Marrakech with my sister and she got sick during our stay. As she has allergies I was a bit nervous about finding medication that would not be dangerous for her to take. I asked the hotel manager Hicham about it and he promptly delivered some medicine to our door.  I also made the mistake of purchasing a mirror without any real regards of how I was to get it home. Hicham took the mirror and went to DSL and priced shipping fees and then looked around and found a bag that I could fit the mirror in that I could purchase for a lot less than shipment. All of this without accepting the tip that I offered!  I have traveled quite a bit but there are still often times that something unexpected comes up and I start feeling a little nervous about finding my way about. These little things often seem big when you are in unfamiliar places but with Hicham and Kevin and the rest of the staff I felt surrounded by warmth and a little less further from home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Hidden away within the alleyways of the Medina is this true haven of tranquility. From the moment we stepped over the threshold we felt so welcome. All of the staff have such a calm manner and nothing is too much trouble for them.  What could be better than relaxing on the roof terrace looking out across to the snow covered Atlas mountains?  A big thank you to Hicham and his staff for making our first stay in Marrakech so memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: The most welcoming hotel and we were pampered from start to finish
Review_Text: Thankfully the manager had arranged our airport transfer and our driver delivered us to the virtually hidden front door of the Riad Nafis in the alleyways behind the monarchs private residence. On stepping inside we were in a beautifully appointed world of tranquility. The manager Hicham and his staff were attentive to our every wish and to ensure our stay was memorable - it certainly was. All the food we were served was authentic Moroccan and of the highest quality and we considered it to be far nicer than anything on offer in the city. The breakfasts were fabulous and the time taken to enjoy them on the rooftop terrace really started the day off well. The roof terrace also had sun loungers with towels and large straw hats provided (Essential). We were told to treat the Riad as our own family home and it really was easy to do so.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hicham was very helpful and all of the staff were really nice 24/7 service. great location near the square close to city centre. breakfast was nice as well the rooms are well equipped and cleaned up within a few hours of you leaving the room multiple times a day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nirav D wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Excellent service at this place and staff made us feel at home. Hicham provided us with everything we needed and suggested great places for us to visit near Marrakech. Over all had a lovely stay at Riad Nafis and would definitely stay here again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Neil E wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Nafis for 5 nights the hotel is in a great location perfectly clean and comfortable and the staff are incredibly attentive with nothing being too much trouble. It's the only hotel I've stayed at where you have breakfast when you're ready. Will definitely stay here again when I return to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John D C wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Riad Nafis is very well situated just inside the Medina within walking distance of the Sadian Tombs and the main Square.It has both a roof terrace for breakfast and sunbathing and a plunge pool on the ground floor.An excellent breakfast is provided and your host Hirscham takes great care of all his guestshe even escorted us through the windy streets to the main street where taxis are available.One hintarrange with Hirscham to be met at the airport and brought to the riad.Once there finding your way about is relatively easy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: c r wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: We had a long weekend - 4 nights - at the Riad Nafis. The Riad is hard to find - taxi driver had no idea - and can be reached only on foot. The hotel itself is lovely with rooms arranged around a courtyard. Our 1st floor room was very clean with a comfortable bed and en suite. We had our breakfast (yogurt pastries coffee orange juice eggs) on the roof terrace which is extensive and furnished with tables and chairs and sunbeds and offers a view over the rooftops. We also had dinner one night in the hotel (meals need to be ordered in the morning) which was good with interesting beetroot appetiser. However the best aspect of this hotel is Hicham and his staff; always helpful always polite always on hand. The 5 stars is really for service
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A beautiful riad in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed 4 nights at Riad Nafis. Hicham and the team made every effort to ensure that our first visit to Morocco was memorable indeed.    The riad is beautiful and considering its central location it is incredibly peaceful. Our room was very comfortable with a wonderfully spacious en suite shower room.    We booked the airport transfer through the riad which I would recommend and we received a tremendously warm welcome from Hicham followed by a wonderful evening meal which we had booked in advance.    The following morning was warm enough for breakfast on the lovely rooftop terrace. Hicham spent time explaining the local area and outlining trips we might want to take. We were incredibly lucky to be shown many of the well-known sites of Marrakech by a knowledgeable and charming guide Mustapha including the beautiful Majorelle gardens.    The following day we took a trip to the Ourika valley and had fun scrambling up the rocks to see the waterfalls. It probably helps if you're fit (which we're not!) but we managed nonetheless. Our third day was spent in Essouira a very picturesque fishing port with a fascinating history - would definitely recommend 'Chez Sam' for a great lunch.    A small word of caution; Hicham recommended a restaurant for an evening meal which unfortunately we didn't find. If anyone approaches you offering to 'help' you find the way beware! However the following evening we had a tremendous meal at Le Foundouk just north of the souks.    Our final meal was on the rooftop terrace at Riad Nafis. Wonderful food and charming service as ever from Kamal.    I could not recommend Riad Nafis more highly to anyone contemplating a first visit to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David T.G.S. wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Title: Outstanding, lovely and authentic Riad - Excellent Host!
Review_Text: Perfect location to explore places of interest. Beautiful rooms and breathtaking (view from) roof terrace. Delicious breakfast and exquisite dinner. Finally "one-of-a-kind" due to excellent team managed by Hicham: Thank You for unique and unforgettable days in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michael t wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: This is a great place to stay. Comfortable with a great breakfast and lovely roof terrace in a nice quiet safe area but near all main attractions. However the staff are exceptional and make the place really special. I think we were lucky to have chosen the Nafis. Thanks to all the staff and also to other trip advisors reviews for leading us here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: David C wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: The Riad Nafis was exceptional for its customer service and its warm welcoming homely feel. The Manager Hicham his associate Kamal and all of the other kitchen and domestic staff were uniformly charming helpful available and gave us much useful advice and information upon the location and quality of the attractions and facilities in Marrakech. They were quick to adapt to any problems or needs we had and were outstandingly friendly together with their excursion driver Aziz when my partner badly sprained her ankle at the Ourika Falls; Aziz recommended quick effective medical treatment from a local healer and avoiding the need for long and potentially expensive visits to a hospital or private clinic and ravel insurance claims. I would certainly visit again and would also commend them for their value for money excellent in every way.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Riad Nafis is an absolute gem - a haven of tranquillity on the edge of the medina. It is beautifully decorated and very comfortable (taking mint tea under the rooftop pergola or in the lounge was a perfect way to recharge the batteries between forays in to the souks). Even more importantly the staff are very welcoming and friendly. In particular we would like to praise and thank Hicham the manager. He could not have been more helpful. One evening we were at a restaurant on Djemaa el-Fna when without warning I had a seizure (the first in several years in spite of taking anti-epileptics). My husband rang the Riad to ask for someone to meet our taxi and help us back to the Riad. Instead Hicham came all the way to the restaurant and physically helped get me to the taxi and then to the Riad at the other end. What a hero! We were/are so very grateful.  I must also praise Abdul the chefs cooking. We made a reservation to eat there the first evening. Having told them what we didn‚Äôt eat/like he then chose the dishes for us. It was a great introduction to Moroccan food ‚Äì everything was delicious and included things we may not have been adventurous enough to order from a menu. We ate there again our last evening and were similarly impressed.  Our main advice to anyone staying here would be to ask the Riad to organise a taxi from the airport. Like so many buildings in the Medina it is not possible to get a car particularly close to the Riad. Having arranged the transfer Hicham met our taxi. Without that I really don‚Äôt know how we would have found the Riad.  We will definitely be returning to Marrakech and will definitely stay at the Riad Nafis again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Nafis was the first Riad we stayed at in Morocco and I am so glad we chose to stay here. Rashid and his team (Abdul Najhat etc.) are the most wonderful helpful folks. We were welcomed with mint tea and Moroccan sweet treats! Rashid and Laurent promptly responded to my queries before arrival. I had arranged airport pickup through the Riad and it worked out very well. Riad Nafis has five rooms all decorated differently. Our room was nice and cosy. The wi-fi was free and had a strong signal. The Riad is close to all the major attractions and being next to royal palace means there is good security in the general area. We would love to stay there again should our travel plans take us to Marrakech in future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Nafis is lovely fabulous rooms attentive staff. minutes walk from all major attractions the manager can organise anything you want e.g transfers guides and other recommendations. if you want an amazing meal in outstanding surroundings treat yourself to l'orangerie across the road. Pick this Riad above others
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tina E wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: We stayed for 3 nights at the Nafis and I have to say it is really a nice cozy and lovely place. Every room has it own design which makes them so unique special and cute ;o)  Rashid (Manager) and the stuff there is very helpful and kind. They welcome you on the terrasse with a The a la menthe and Rashid then talks you through Marrakech especially Medina shows you places on the map where you have to go and recommends you dinners. Which is not usual to be honest going to a Hotel and the Manager takes such good care of the guests.  The Riad is very well located it is 5min walk to the Koutoubia Mosque and let's say 10min to the Jemaa El-Fnaa square.  I would definitely recommend to everyone to book a Pick up from the Airport to the Hotel otherwise its Mission Impossible to find the Riad. And just to don't have the stress when you arrive there with finding a Taxi dealing a prize etc please book a pick up! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!  If you are looking for a cute quiet and charming place in Medina then Nafis is definitely recommendable.  We stayed at the Berbere Room which has a very nice Bath :)  Thank you all for taking good care of us :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Don't hesitate to book a stay at Riad Nafis - really wonderful rooms breakfast and most importantly helpful and welcoming staff. Our plans changed because of floods and road closures to the desert (too bad!) but we had no issues with Riad Nafis adjusting to our needs. 5 minute walk to the souk and main square yet far enough away from noise and hectic streets.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely experience in the Medina. Highly recommended!
Review_Text: Stayed there with my family and loved everything about it! After making our booking we contacted the hotel to ask few questions before our travel and Laurent was very helpful and prompt with his responses. Excellent customer service at all times from all of the staff. When we arrived Rachid welcomed us with tea and provided information of places to visit. The place is beautiful and calm. Very small Riad and that makes it unique and special. We also pre-booked a dinner and asked to be surprised with the menu and we were! Tagine salad and fruit for dessert. We had dinner at the terrace and it was lovely. They also a delicious and fresh breakfast! The rooms are beautifully furnished all in different styles. I highly recommend this Riad!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jan C wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Myself and 3 friends have just returned from a wonderful 3 night stay at Riad Nafis. Taking advice from previous reviewers we asked the hotel to arrange airport transfer for us...a good move as it would have been tricky for us to find as it is located within a maze of alleys and side streets. A plain door belies the stylish oasis of calm beyond...and we were greeted with hot sweet mint tea by Rashid who welcomed us to our 'home' in Marrakech. We had also pre-booked dinner for our first night which was served on the roof terrace - delicious Tagine salad and fruit. All the Nafis staff were lovely and all very attentive. The rooms are simply furnished but straight from a style magazine set! The beds were extremely comfortable and we all slept well. The main square is a 15 minute walk away and although the area is busy we never felt hassled or unsafe. We loved it....Riad Nafis was the perfect base for a fabulous short break. 5 stars and thoroughly thoroughly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Lynne N wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Spent 4 nights at this delightful Riad and were made very welcome.  Upon arrival Rachid greeted us with mint tea and pastries and sat down with us to show us a map and advise us where to explore. Situated very close to the Royal Palace where we felt very safe because there were several guards.  Delightful to have breakfast on the roof in the sunshine.  Would recommend asking them to arrange for taxi to collect you from the airport as this made it so easy and comfortable for us to get to the Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Natacha S wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: Riad nafis is the best guest house ive ever stayed in for sure. My friend and I were so lucky to have chosen this riad for our 10 days in Marrakech. We left with beautiful memories of wonderful new friends.  Thank you Rashid Abdel and Jalil. We will never forget our time with you XXX  And we will be back. Save a room for us.

Review_Date: M P wrote a review Aug 2014
Review_Text: What an amazing experience we had on our four day adventure of the wonderful Marrakech.Following a night flight we arrived at 2am exhausted and frustrated (waiting in immigration took a while and the riad was a little tricky to find but we were shown by a helpful local)we knocked on this not so special looking door. How wrong we're we on entering we were met by hachim with such warmth into our ' home ' and felt instantly at ease we were shown to our amazing room we stayed on the first floor the decor was luxury and the view of the pool was superb.  On having a peaceful nights sleep we were met by Rachid the general manager who gave us a general tour and told us about the history of Marrakech and things to do as it was my birthday! Breakfast was whenever we woke up and it consisted of breads pancakesjams yoghurt and tea and coffee and lovely fresh orange juice which was lovely. Marrakech is a busy bustling hot city so it was fab to return home in the evening to chill and have a shower and rest in such a great riad. The service was 5 star they couldn't do enough for us! We would definitely recommend a stay there so authentic and genuine.  A lil tip in Marrakech haggle with prices and some cabs are after a quick buck ! we found a fantastic cab driver who was reasonable his telephone number 0610765278 ( cannot remember his name unfortunately ) whenever we rang him from anywhere we were he would be there to pick us up and take us to our next destination and back to the riad and didn't charge over the top prices.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Hannah C wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Title: Keep Calm and Stay at Riad Nafis
Review_Text: What a wonderful Riad. Such a calming place to stay in this amazing city. We arrived late and had our first (and best) tagine and bottle of lovely Moroccan wine on the roof overlooking the houses and listening to the birds. Having a dip in the pool after a hot day out exploring was just fantastic. We had five days at Riad Nafis and it was just fabulous. The staff were brilliant really helpful and informative. Thanks for everything.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Trip Educator wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: Let me start with the general manager Rashid. When was the last time you personally sat with the general manager of a hotel upon check-in and were served a complimentary mint tea to sip on while tasting a variety of local treats? And did that same general manager give you a tour of his luxurious hotel and provide you with a map and suggested itinerary on what to see in the city you were visiting? Then when you checked out did the general manager help carry your luggage to an awaiting taxi? Didn't think so!    But Rashid and the entire staff at the Riad Nafis will make your trip to Marrakesh wonderful! You'll have a great breakfast promptly served upon request on the rooftop terrace while watching the stork give himself a bath on the minaret a couple of blocks away. The location is terrific - within the medina (old city walls) and next to the Presidential Palace but away from the never ending noise of the Jemaa El Fna. It's a moderate walk to everything in Marrakesh you'll want to see and easy to find your way around thanks to Rashid's directions and map. When you return home you'll leave the energy of the city center behind and get a good night's rest.    If I ever return to Marrakesh I'll happily stay at the Riad Nafis where service comes first!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Nafis was an absolute gem in an amazing city. I read lots of reviews before our stay and thought to myself that nowhere can be this perfect but riad nafis is even better than perfect.    We arrived late and were greeted at the airport and taken direct to the Riad. I would recommend this as the riad is tucked away in the narrow streets of the medina and could be hard to find on your first attempt. Upon arriving at the riad we were shown our room. A beautiful twin bed room with air con and good shower. We had pre booked dinner and were shown around the riad and enjoyed a delicious 3 course meal on the roof terrace. The service was first class and the food was one of the best meals we had during our stay in marrakech.  We were also served a lovely breakfast each morning on the roof terrace a combination of fresh fruit yoghurt fresh bread and pastries. Just what you need to start the day before you head into the hustle of the city.    The riad is approx 10minutes stroll from the main square. We found it useful to use the Koutoubia Mosque as a guide and we never got lost (apart from in the Souks when the stall holders deliberately send you in wrong direction by saying some directions are closed- all fun though!)    Upon our return to the riad mid afternoon we spent a few hours on the sun terrace unwinding before heading back to the square for dinner in the evening.    Staff at the riad were extremely helpful and kind offering advice and sharing best places to dine etc. They were extremely polite and made our stay extra special. Fresh towels daily and they helped us make the most of our stay they also booked a horse and carriage to collect us from riad and take us to the jadin majorelle. It was also lovely to share a mint tea on the roof terrace with them they really are genuine people who care for their guests.    We found that we were the only people to be guests in the riad for some of our stay it felt like home from home pottering around the building up to roof then down to our room (although I can only imagine having such a beautiful home!)    I would definitely recommend this riad for anyone travelling to marrakesh. Amazing place. Praise to Rachid and the team who work long hours for the benefit of the guests.    thank you Riad Nafis  steph and ali :-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I would like to begin with a BIG thanks to all the staff of the RIAD NAFIS...they made our stay unforgettable since the moment we arrived. They welcomed us with a cup of mint tea and few local biscuits.. the room was perfect ..and the Terrace on the top floor was something amazing especially during the evening and also in the morning when we were having our breakfast    I would recommend to enjoy dinner there the food and the service are simply wonderful...and we had a really pleasant night with the guys of the RIAD ..nice talk to you...    Marrakech city makes you feel tired and stressed out after having walked all day around and when you reach the door of this special RIAD it is like going to Paradise....peace quite and relax will wait for you behind that door... Hope to see you soon...CIAO    Paola & Francesco
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A wonderful stay at Riad Nafis
Review_Text: Home from home. Rachid and team gave 100% to ensure we had a memorable holiday. We arranged a collection from airport through the riad- we were worried as flight was delayed but no need- collected and taken to door if Riad( recommend you do this). Made welcome as soon as we arrived. Lovely rooms very clean and comfortable towels changed daily. Breakfast taken on roof terrace- plentiful and delicious. We also ate at the Riad for one evening- highly recommend wow the food delicious and as usual service with a smile. The Riad is about a 15 minute walk to the square- we got a bit lost but all part of the fun. Rachid provides lots of information and recommendations. It was our 25 years wedding anniversary and a lovely bottle of wine (and a beautiful letter that made me cry) was left in our room. We were waved off with tears in our eyes- we were sad to leave our friends behind. Don't hesitate to book this Riad! You won't be disappointed .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We couldn't have been happier with our stay at Riad Nafis! It was very clean the rooftop was cozy the water temperature was great and the water pressure was great. (We had a room with a shower.) The staff couldn't have been more friendly or more helpful! It was an easy walk from the riad to the main square.    We contacted Riad Nafis and scheduled our airport transfers and excursions/tours without any trouble at all. The tour guides that Riad Nafis recommended were top notch as well.    The only way we'd hesitate to stay here again would be if we couldn't have a room with a shower. (Some rooms only have a tub with a handheld spout.) We're shower people and do not like baths so that'd be our only block to staying here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I cannot say enough wonderful things about this RIad. From the moment we were collected from the airport until the second we bid farewell to the manager we were treated like old friends. The rooms are very clean and beautifully decorated and we enjoyed having a delicious breakfast and relaxing on the rooftop terrace which had amazing views. Seriously though this Riad was so peaceful and calm providing a welcome contrast to the bustle of the Djema el-Fna and all the excitement going on outside. I would recommend this Riad to anyone! (Also I highly recommend contacting the Riad ahead of time to arrange transfer from the airport. It was much easier than getting off a flight and haggling with a taxi driver and much cheaper too!)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A peaceful haven away from the chaotic noise
Review_Text: This was our first holiday with our ten month old baby. From the moment we entered we felt a wave of calmness and peace surround us. The ambience of the place was set by the soft music playing in the living area overlooking the pool.    We stayed there for 5 nights and didn't see any of the other guests apart from our first morning. It felt very intimate and just like home away from home. We had access to the kitchen 24hrs a day. This was necessary to make up bottles for our baby etc.    Rasheed the hotel manager really made us feel at home. Unfortunately for me I was very ill one day during our holiday. But Rasheed called a Dr for me and after a few shots I was fine. I was really looked after well by the whole staff there. Not only this but my son was entertained by everyone whenever he started crying.    We stayed in the junior suite located on the ground floor. The room was really romantic. The riad itself has all these gorgeous little details that make it amazing. It's a very traditional riad which makes it so exquisite. Even the doors to the rooms are lovely.    We regret that we never managed to have dinner here as we were always out in the evenings but we loved our breakfast everyday. Fresh pancakes biscuits and cake accompanied with fresh orange juice amazing jams yoghurt and tea or coffee.    This riad is situated very closed to everything. In fact we never needed a taxi. Everything was walking distance. On our first day Rasheed showed us how to get to the main road and back. We would have got lost otherwise. We made several trips to jemaa el fna (the main square) in a day as it was only 15min walk away.    We also visited an art museum and Bahia Palace which were again walking distance.    My favourite part of Marrakech was the shopping!!! The souks and stalls are just amazing. It's annoying to haggle for everything though. But you get the hang of it after awhile. Also neither of us speaks Arabic or French but we managed to get by somehow as many of the locals speak English.    I really enjoyed our trip to Marrakech and would love to return again one day. And if I did I would definitely book this riad again.

My husband and I stayed in March 2014 we felt so welcome the staff are amazing here always there to help. I emailed before our stay to arrange airport transfer and a trip to the Atlas Mountains they were very fast and efficient at answering my emails and booking this for us. The breakfast is great and we had dinner on one night which was delicious definitely recommend this. On leaving we decided to get a taxi to the airport ourselves Rashid walked us to the road and got us a good deal with the taxi driver which we really appreciated we felt very at home at riad nafis and will recommend to anyone we also hope to visit again sometime. So a big thankyou to everyone at riad nafis for making our stay in Marrakech so fantastic. Thankyou! Lucy and kali
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Christopher H wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Title: Excellent place to stay in the medina!
Review_Text: The staff of this riad went out of their way to make our arrival seamless and our stay comfortable. The room was spotless and thoughtfully decorated. Thank you to Rashid for an interesting and informative orientation to Marrakesh. We loved the beautiful and sunny rooftop terrace and the courtyard pool. The breakfast was delicious especially the homemade yoghurt and fresh squeezed orange juice. We highly recommend this riad and would definitely return for another visit. Thank you! A & C from San Francisco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed for 4 nights in this Riad and would most definitely recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in Marrakech. The Riad is beautiful very clean safe and all the staff were wonderful. From the moment you arrive you are made to feel at home we were greeted on arrival with pastries and mint tea. We were then given a short and helpful introduction to Marrakech by Rachid. The Riad is in a really convenient location just a 10 minute walk to Jemaa el Fna square. We would advise you book airport transfers with the Riad as it can be difficult to find first time the prices are very reasonable. We would definitely stay at Riad Nafis again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for 4 nights and loved it. It feels like living in a B&B...there are 4-5 rooms and the hospitality of the staff is amazing. The pictures are true its very clean and the breakfast is delicious. The location is awesome very close to all attractions and near the Royal Palace so there are plenty of guards around.  The bed size are European and are a tad bit small if you are from north america. Also there is no lock on the door but there is a safe in the bathroom.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Me and my friend stayed here February 2014 and we absolutely have no regrets.    While my friends and I are generally budget-hostel seeking types but I'm North African and know first hand that it pays to go a bit further on the stay chain for safety security and cleanliness. Especially as a woman traveler.    My brother and my dad had been to Morocco the previous summer and stayed at Riad Nafis' sister location in Marrakech Riad Al Badia. They praised the staff and hospitality and were excited about the location in the center of it all. When booking I lucked out the other riad was booked but was given a room at Riad Nafis for a very fair price.    Our room was spacious and spotless the bathroom was beautiful with plenty of hot water & good pressure (things I often take for granted till I am traveling).    Rachid & Hicham were both great hosts and unbelievably helpful from our bags recommendations to eat helping us book our trip into the sahara (desert majesty- if you were wondering is the way to go!) to just being kind and friendly.    The breakfasts were fresh and delicious (carb/gluten heavy for those of you who are wary of those things) and we sat in for dinner on our last night which was so filling and absolutely delicious. Great in house chef Na√Øma!    The airport pickup provided by the Riad is definitely more than you would pay for in a cab (but you would have to haggle relentlessly with the driver of course) but was so seamless and easy especially getting off a long flight or hurrying to get to the airport - I'd highly recommend it.    Oh and the wifi connection was great if you're into that sort of thing!    I really would not change a thing about my stay and am so thankful for such a wonderful experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Fawkya A wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: Very friendly atmosphere . Staff were very welcoming and provided excellent hospitality . We were very honoured to have met mr Laurent who gave us excellent advise about places we must see in Marrakech and looked after us in a very good way . Kareema ( one of the girls who work in the hotel ) can do very nice henna tattoo if you are interested .

Review_Title: Home Away from Home - 6 Star Hospitality.
Review_Text: It feels like you are staying with your dear friends or relatives when you are staying at Riad Nafis. From the moment you arrive to the moment you leave they take care of everything and create beautiful memories of holiday and time spend there. For these attributes I award them six stars as this is exactly what I am looking from my holiday.    I choose Riad Nafis on basis of past reviews for my Marrakech holiday and made booking through Expedia. For my excursions and day trips I then opened a line with them 30 days advance of arrival all my mails were promptly replied. I also booked a day trip to Atlas Mountain  a guided tour of Marrakech and Dinner on First night with them and it was all arranged without hassle.    As advised earlier by fellow travellers a pick up taxi was booked from the airport ( cost Euro 24). This is a MUST you want to start your holiday peacefully and without stress. We were welcomed with mint Tea all the directions were provided.The staff (Na√Øma Najat Karima Hicham Rachid & Laurent) are excellent attentive but not intrusive they did all they could to make us welcome. There are only five rooms we stayed on the first floor and took two rooms one with a shower and one with a bath and both were equally good. The rooms are very clean and comfortable and bedding quality is on par with any good 5 star Hotel.    A continental breakfast (Orange Juice home made yogurt pastries Crepe's etc.) is served WITH SMILE on the roof garden weather permitting or in the Lounge and is of good quality.    The location of Riad has Pros and Cons  on the plus side it is in old city 10 mins walking distance to the all the tourist spots on the Minus side some travellers expecting a posh location may find the entry walk to it from the main road a bit downmarket. However once you enter the Riad and appreciate the character and the service it makes up more than for that one negative aspect.    One meal at the Riad is recommended to appreciate fine Moroccan cooking and comes at reasonable price. The staff will be happy to provide you recommendations in case you want to venture out.    We would like to Sincerely Thank - Na√Øma Najat Karima Hicham Rachid & Laurent for creating beautiful memories for us which will stay with us for the rest of life and whenever we will think of Marrakech we will fondly think of our time spend at Riad Nafis.    I whole heartedly support the earlier statements "If you want to stay in the heart of the Medina and get a real flavour of Marrakech then this is the place to stay".
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: So glad we chose this Riad - the staff cannot do enough for you and make the holiday really special. Lovely rooms spotlessly clean everywhere. Location great - easy access to both new and old city. Rachid Ismail Naomi and the other girls were amazing.
