Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Erwin T wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Title: Best Place to Stay in Marrakesh
Review_Text: Before I booked our stay in this riad I made sure that I read previous reviews. One thing I noticed right away are the responses written by the riad staff on the reviews. They sounded very caring courteous and respectful towards their guests. As far as I could tell it is the only riad that responds to reviews on TripAdvisor. It was a sign that they truly go above-and-beyond on customer service not only during the stay but even after. So I did a little bit of experimentation to determine the level of customer service before our stay. A few days before my wife and I left for Marrakech I emailed the riad and requested for airport-to-hotel transport and for options on sightseeing tours. Laurent replied within a few short hours confirmed our transport and listed our options. So right in the beginning I was already impressed by the responsiveness. So I completed my booking knowing that my (4-months) pregnant wife and I would be in good hands during our 3-night stay in Marrakech.    Upon arrival in the afternoon we saw the driver with the Riad Nafis sign. After a 10-minute van ride through the medina he parked on a busy street and walked with us to the riad. Pre-arranging this transport is definitely a must-do for first-timers in old cities like Marrakesh that has numerous alleyways that do not have names and are not necessarily on a map. We were greeted by Laurent and his staff welcomed us with tea and pastries and showed us around the riad. The place is as beautiful as the pictures shown here on TripAdvisor and elsewhere maybe even more. I think there was only one other couple who was staying there at that time and so the riad felt really intimate and special. We felt at-home in an exotic location. Another great thing is that we ordered our dinner there on our first night. Served as a 3-course meal our tagine dinner was home-cooked plentiful very delicious and romantic. The meal was a fantastic way to cap off a 30-hour journey from the US and a superb way to regain our strength for the next day's city tour.    Laurent arranged for us a full-day tour of the museums and sites with a local guide named Moustafa. I was so happy we did a full-day as opposed to a half-day because we really maximixed that day. We got to see all the museums we wanted to see within the medina got to hear all the inside scoop--history facts/fiction appropriate tipping--from our guide and got the best bargains in the souks. That marketplace is a maze. There is no way a first-timer can efficiently navigate through the souks without a guide. When we got back I braved the relaxation pool at the center of the medina. Like in most non-heated pools once I dipped my body below my shoulders the water became very invigorating. The bath tub in our room was small for me so the dip in the pool was the next best thing to a shower. Plus I listened to soothing Morrocan music from the adjacent lounge area.    I hope this review will help future travelers in deciding where to stay in Marrakesh. I sincerely recommend Riad Nafis as the best place for their service hospitality safety cleanliness and unique Morrocan experience. If given the chance to visit Marrakesh once more I will surely stay at this riad again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Iffat K wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Title: Awesome beautiful riad and the service and staff care is fabulous
Review_Text: Just got back from a 4 day break and stayed at this beautiful riad seriously if ever visiting marrakech forget big hotels stay here the riad is quaint beautiful and very authentic and as for the staff they made it home for us Rashid Laurent and Ishmael and the girls we miss you and thank you for such a wonderful personal service that we have never encountered for in our lives if ever staying there get them to cook a dinner for you its yummiest we hope to be back soon its an oasis in the middle of chaos and the staff make it home for you all keep up the amazing work and thank you for arranging the balloon ride the spa and the morroco themed dinner...all the best
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This is a perfect place to stay!  It is close to the Medina & a pleasant walk to all the central areas. The Riad is just as previous guests have described it is a perfect haven of tranquility. It is spotlessly clean & nothing is too much trouble for the smiling and attentive staff.  Importantly they will make certain that you have your bearings & can find your way back they will advise you on managing the inevitable offers of guides and shops to visit! They are truly interested in what you would like to do & will offer practical advice.  The food is marvelous especially the breakfasts enjoyed on the roof terrace. Relax & enjoy an evening meal there too.  If you would like some Henna ask at the Riad Karina will make it a beautiful experience.  I would really recommend contacting Laurent before you arrive to arrange taxi pick ups it worked perfectly and would be really difficult otherwise.  If we have the good fortune to be able to return to Marrakech this is where I would want to be it is comfortable well located with fabulous staff and gives you a real feeling of connecting with the city that you could not get in a chain hotel.  Thank you Laurent RashidMohamadIshmail Karina & Naima for making our stay so enjoyable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ka K wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: What makes a place wonderful was the staff this was the first hotel/riad we stayed in Morocco for our 12 days trip and was still our favorite although there are more luxury/well decorated hotel we stayed elsewhere. Marrakech is busy and chaotic but we always feel peaceful to be back to this oasis.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Don't stay in a big chain hotel - stay here
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Nafis in September for 5 nights (sorry for posting this review late) and it was amazing in every way. Please don't be afraid to stay in the old city - it was a totally safe place to stay. Other people we have talked to afterwards regretted staying out of town.  After booking the Riad we contacted Laurent to sort out taxi pick up (highly recommend) and depatures a meal on the first evening and quad biking. He responded to our our queries and sorted everything out for us at a reasonable rate.  Upon arrival at the airport our taxi driver was waiting for us. A short walk from the taxi brought us to our Riad. The pictures do not do it justice - it was like walking into an oasis in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. They took our cases showed us round the Riad gave us tea and pasties and generally made us feel relaxed and at home and that was even before we saw the room.  The room was fantastic (Junior Suite Saltana) beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean (like the whole Riad).  We wanted to start exploring and were walked to the main road and shown where we were in relation to the main square - an easy 5 minute walk. We did get lost loads of times in the medina but it was always easy to find our way back to the Riad. The people are all friendly and happy to give directions (for some small change).  You must book a meal at least once in the Riad. We had a vegetarian meal and it was the best we had whilst there - sat on the terrace watching the sun going down. We just felt bad that we could not eat it all. Naima is an amazing cook. The breakfasts are also wondeful. To end a hot dusty day with a dip in the pool was lovely.  Everything about this Riad was perfect but the main thing was the staff. Nothing was ever too much trouble (the quad biking they booked was a fantastic day and a must). They are all so proud of their Riad culture and city and it really showed.  We will be going back there next time we are in Marrackech.  Thanks Laurent Naima Najat Karima Ismail & Noureddine for a fantastic holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Leaving the taxi at the gate next to the wall surrounding the Royal (Residential) Palace and walking five minutes to this riad is to enter a different world of small traders selling food clothing and other goods children kicking soccer balls women in traditional dress hustling along with baskets guards at the palace and even motorbikes in the narrow lanes. Then through a big wooden door one enters a private quiet world where the first sight is the swimming pool filling the space of the courtyard. Inside the staff is eager to fulfill every need and to make one comfortable. The rooms are nice sized and spread over two levels. There are stairs and it is a pleasure to report that the stairwell is wide and the stairs evenly placed. An excellent continental breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace with the amenities of a table cloth and table napkins. The only less-than-enthusiastic things I can say are that 1) the rooms (I was there six nights and stayed in two rooms) are dark and poorly lit and 2) while the location is good Moroccan taxi drivers and others are confused when they are asked to take the passenger to the gate of the Royal Palace because there are several royal palaces one not far away; showing the spot on the map is useless too because Moroccans are not familiar with maps.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Can barely imagine a nicer place to stay

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The ONLY place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: We can't thank the staff of the Riad Nafis enough for a fantastic stay at your Riad. Everything was just perfect and the location is excellent with clost proximity to the old city with all of the charm of a lovely home within the ancient walls. Our group of 4 adults and 1 child commented many times that we felt like Kings and Queens staying here. We really didn't want to leave. The decor is perfect as well as the suites we booked. The breakfast is a very nice traditional Moroccan breakfast with yogurt coffee tea jams and the Moroccan version of crepes/pancakes all served on the beautiful terrace each morning overlooking the city and the stork nests! Make sure to ask for their fantastic mint tea as well. The staff met every wish arranged reservations at wonderful restaurants as well as massages at a beautiful hammam and hooked us up with our favorite tour guide ever Mustafa. (Be sure to ask for him if he's available.) All were arranged at very fair prices for the quality.    HUGE TIP: Put away your Google maps as it will NOT find you in this city. Instead relax and let the staff take care of every desire including airport transfers. We didn't book a transfer to the hotel but I believe this is a MUST. It is difficult and overwhelming to say the least upon your arrival to find your way around in the Medina as it's mostly small dirt roads that are not reachable in a car. It's hard to believe in this day and age that correct maps do not exist of Marrakech but this is the case. We made it safely from the airport but I cannot stress enough that you must use the hotel. It's cost effective and safe.    Again thank you to Rashid and his staff for a wonderful vacation and memories we will never forget.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Christopher W wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Title: A wonderful stay at a beautiful Riad
Review_Text: From the moment we contacted Laurent to arrange transfers (highly recommended) to the moment we left Rachid and the team could not have done anymore to make our stay memorable for all the right reasons. We were told on arrival that the Riad Nafis would be our home for the week and it truly was.  Breakfast was served at a time to suit us (which changed daily!) service was attentive but never overbearing and the riad was a welcome haven from the hussle and bustle of the medina. It's sometimes all about the small touches that make a big difference to how a place feels and that was definitaley the case.  Would recommend at least one meal at Riad Nafis as the food was exceptional the best we tried in Marrakech and the experience of eating on the roof terrace at sunset was very special.  The city itself is a pretty crazy and intense experience but in the nicest possible way. Expect to be hot and dusty on your walk back to the riad dreaming of taking a dip in the cool pool before lounging on the terrace and claiming bragging rights on who haggled the best discount at the souks! Yes the doors don't have locks and some of the rooms don't have a stand up shower but that is all part of the charm and we felt very safe more like being a guest in someone's home rather than staying in a faceless hotel.  If you're going to Marrakech stay here and experience Morrocan hospitality first hand.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Betty H wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Title: A safe Haven in the midst of the medina
Review_Text: The Riad Nafis truly is a safe and great place to stay.
