Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Andy n wrote a review May 2013
Review_Title: Delightful oasis, staff very friendly and attentive, hard to find
Review_Text: Arrived late at night around 21:00 took a taxi from the airport but the driver didn't know the address. Managed to get us quite close but had to ask a young lad the way and unloaded us at the end of an alley - luckily 2 more youths showed us the way (for a fee!) because it is well-hidden and involves a few turns.  The manager greeted us and showed us the hotel I got the feeling he is very proud. The hotel is boutique only 4 or 5 rooms. Ours was quite small but adequate. It was comfortable although there was only a bathtub with a shower attachment and no curtain which made showering difficult.  A word of advice - wear earplugs. The call to prayer in the morning is very loud and occurs at around 04:45!  Breakfast was served on the roof and was very good and the staff attentive.  There is a pool in the centre of the hotel but we didn't use it ourselves.  If you want a hotel out of the main area (but still within walking distance to the main square and Mosque) I would recommend this - although finding it once you arrive in Marrakech may depend on a bit of luck. If I were the owner I'd look at providing a pick-up service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Our second stay at Riad Nafis was perfection....
Review_Text: Since staying at Riad Nafis last year we returned with friends for another Moroccan adventure. Marrakech and Riad Nafis were even better the second time. Our taxi driver was alarmed when I led the way through the maze towards Riad Nafis. I knew my way and was very happy to walk through the front door. Being greeted by the same staff members was like coming home. We stayed in the Junior Suite Sultana again and were very comfortable. Friends joined us in Marrakech and based on Mr. Olier's excellent recommendation we had an amazing three day adventure through the Atlas Mountains and Sahara with Adil with from 4x4 Camel. My passion for Moroccan food was given a significant boost with a pastilla cooking class with Mr. Olier and the Riad's cook. Based on the technique and recipe I look forward to recreating their delicious version of pastilla. Very happy with our return trip and looking forward to a return visit in the future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Four of us stayed at Riad Nafis in April and would not stay anywhere else now. From the airport pickup to the return journey nothing was too much trouble. Laurent and his lovely team were so attentive it was amazing.  We recommend everything we did which was all organised by the Riad. We did a half day tour with Mustapha which was well worth it. Also the Hamman which was certainly an experience. Laurent also recommended and booked restaurants for us which was great as we were only in Marrakech for 3 days.  The rooms were spotless the meal we had was delicious and you could not fault the staff.  Thank you to LaurentRashidHashim and all the other staff that we can't name.  What a lovely trip.    NB book your airport runs with the Riad. They are waiting at the airport for you and take you to the door. And the same on the return
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It was our first trip to Morocco and We stayed here for three nights in April 2013.    Upon arriving at the airport we withdrew some local money from ATM and got a taxi. There was a big board outside the airport saying to go to city the taxi charge is 100 MAD but the guys there insisted as we are a couple charge therefore is 200 MAD. Go figure that out! So we had no choice but paid 200. After arriving at the old town the driver said he couldn't go any further and dropped us off outside the palace. Two little kids then showed us to the hotel's door. To be very frank if not for them there was no chance that we will find the hotel ourselves as it is really hard to spot. Then the kids wanted money. I emptyed my pocket and can only find Euro change but the kids wanted 'paper money'. The smallest MAD money I had was 200. So I refuse to give them that. The arguing was heard by people inside Nafis and they let us in. The whole experience was very stressful!    The staff was very friendly the hotel was charming with a swimming pool in the centre court yard. However our bath room only has a bath tub and there was no shower curtain around it and the tap can't be hung up. To have a shower I had to sit in the tub and wash my hair and then call my husband to hold the tap and rinse for me! It was very inconvenient. I had to do the same for my husband too. But there are still water spilled everywhere.    Our room was very small. We had nowhere to open our suitcases and had to use the bed everytime we need to get something out which is all the time. There were two very big pillars in the room right in front of the bed. My husband walked into it to go to the bathroom the first night. In fact they are very hard to miss even during the day because the room is so small.    We love the terrace breakfast and the location of the hotel but overall it's disappointing.

Review_Date: Meghan B wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: Beautiful Riad above-and-beyond service amazing breakfast every morning on the roof deck. I would recommend this Riad to anyone! It can be a little tough to find so be sure to ask for directions ahead of time but it's a very safe location as it's right next to the royal residence so there are lots of guards around. Wonderful experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We are on our way back from a week at the Riad Nafis and cannot rate it highly enough.  The location slightly away from the madness of the El Fna but close enough to walk to in less than ten minutes suited us perfectly.  Our room was lovely rustic enough to feel we were away from a typical European style hotel but spotlessly maintained.  The sun terrace was great with a view of the storks nesting atop a nearby mosque. We ate breakfast there each morning which was delicious and served at any time up to midday.  The staff were incredibly attentive and as there are only a few rooms able to look after you without the usual "what is your room number" which feels like a nice touch. We booked a few restaurants through the hotel including a dinner at Kosybar where they managed to guarantee a table by the edge of the terrace. When we arrived the maitre d' told us they would not normally do this so hats off to the Nafis.  We had an issue with a trip to the Atlas Mountains which the management dealt with in an incredibly generous and understanding way.

We stayed for 3 nights here and it was a great introduction to Marrakesh. The rooms are verr tastefully done and the roof terrace is a great place to relax. We ate out at a couple of so called 'top' restaurants and the Riads food was so much better. Home cooking at its best.

When we arrived the staff said we should consider the Riad our house and feel at home! And this is how we felt. Rooms are nicely decorated and clean pool illuminated at night roof terrace for the breakfast with a view to the Atlas mountains 5 minutes walking to the main place Jemaa el fna and the Souks. Area is very safe as it is next to one of the kings palaces with lots of guards. Extremely helpful and friendly staff who simply assist you with all you need. Have them organize the taxi ride from and to the airport as they get a better price than at least we got and also a tour guide maybe for the first day. Ok the Muezzin wakes you up every morning at 5 a.m. but this is part of the arabic experience you want to have and unavoidable unless you are outside a big city. Beds are more on the hard side but good for your back. I certainly would stay there again and can recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Visiting Morocco is something my girlfriend and I have been looking forward to for a long time much like many visitors we googled and tripadvis-ed places to stay in Marrakech and we knew there would be good and bad comments but we took a gamble with Riad Nafis because of its great location.    Now that we have returned home we have to say the Riad was one of the best things that could have happened and it made our trip to Morocco so much more meaningful. The staff were very helpful and made us feel welcome from the first moment we walked in. From a non biased point of view My girlfriend and I can honestly say there are no flaws in choosing this Riad. The people the location the price is definitely worth visiting.    I think our trip would not have been the same if it hadnt been for Riad Nafis.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Julet A wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: I can't recommend this Riad enough the building and the people there are wonderful from the moment we arrived made us feel so welcome and at ease. We had arranged with the Riad for a driver to come and meet us I definitely suggest doing this as the riad is a little difficult to find at first especially if you arriving late at night as we did. The riad can't be reached by car so our driver stopped at the nearby and lead us right to the door where we were greeted by Hicham who went to make us mint tea and brought mini pastries as we relaxed in the salon after our long journey.  Breakfast each morning was tasty pancakes and bread with diffirent flavors of jam  It's a perfect place to relax after fighting your way through the souks a proper escape and the hospitality was second to none. the manager and his team went out of their way to make our stay amazing and they definitely succeeded
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Riad Nafis for 3 nights last week. It was perfect for us. A great location for walking around the city and the roof terrace provided a quiet place to wind down and relax. The room was lovely and the staff were very helpful. It's a little tricky to find but if you show the address to one of the locals they will be happy to help you out for a small fee (around 20dh). You can't go wrong with Nafis and at such good value for money stop shopping around and book it before it's too late.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Nafis feels like home from the first moment you step in as you are welcomed by the super-friendly staff. The owners are very helpful . They seem to treat the place as 'home' and a big family. The three girls are all very nice and wonderful cooks. One of them Karima does the beautiful henna tatoos in the convenience of the riad lounge.  The rooms are traditionally decorated without compromising your comfort. The lounge and the terrace are wonderful for eating and chilling.  I also have to mention Hicham the night guard who is one of the most friendly people I have ever met in a life time!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A hidden gem in the Medina
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at this wonderful Riad while spending a long weekend without the kids in Marrakech. The service was extraordinary. Rachid and his collegues were helpful in any imaginary way. They gave advice on where to eat or shop and what to see. They even organized a box for the lamp we bought at the souk.  The room was beautiful! An oriental dream! I can't even discribe the wonderful bathroom! You have to see by yourself!    Breakfast was inclusive and you can chosse to have it inside next to the pool or on the amazing roof terrace. We were lucky with the weather and had breakfast upstairs every day. Also this was delicious!    If we ever return to Marrakech and thats very likely this Riad is our first choice once more!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We thoroughly enjoyed every moment of our stay at Riad Nafis. From the moment we arrived the staff were superb and made us feel totally at home. The twin room was delightful with beautiful furniture and ornaments extremely comfortable beds and an excellent shower. Every morning we were greeted with a smile and a delicious breakfast and first rates tips for our activities that day. All of the staff were so attentive and there was a great balance between catering for our needs and letting us relax in peace. The roof top terrace and pool were beautiful and the location was perfect as it was right next to the royal palace so very safe and quiet but only 8 minutes walk from the main square in the heart of the Medina. We can't recommend Riad Nafis enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Golden butterflyfish wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Title: Look no further - here is the place for you to stay!
Review_Text: The staff at Riad Nafis is absolutely wonderful! The Riad itself is an oasis in hectic Marrakech after hours of sightseeing you come home and relax on the lovely roof terrace enjoying the view of the Atlas mountains and the impressing storks' nests atop the many minarets. If the weather is fine there are sunbeds including hats (nice thought!) to spend some time reading. We were lucky to have breakfast here two of our four mornings the others we enjoyed in the lovely salon. Our room Berbere was small but cosy and comfortable with a big bathroom. I very much liked the decor of the riad tasteful and modern with the "oriental" twist. Not too much of anything just good taste. Both my husband and I came down with the flu which confined us a bit to our room but everybody in the staff was ever so friendly and tried to help thank you very much for your kindness!  No problem to find the place; we pre-ordered with the Riad to be picked up at the airport and on our first evening we were escorted to the Jeema el Fna so we would be able to find our way. On our first morning we were introduced to the sights of Marrakech. That I call top class service!  So no need to look any further - here is the place to stay!

Review_Date: Felicity S wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: Despite initial misgivings about location this proved to be a truly wonderful experience. Beautifully themed rooms superbly clean and wonderful staff who could not do enough for us. The food was beyond compare. And as for the views from the roof terrace at breakfast . . .This is somewhere you would want to return to again and again. A big thank you to all the staff who made a first visit to Marrakech unforgettable. PS visit the Alhambra spa recommended by the staff at the riad. Oh so worth it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I could not have wished for a nicer place to have stayed the service was exceptional with a personal touch. The staff happily catered for our individual needs we were walked to the main square on our first night of arriving to ensure we did not get lost. The staff spoke excellent English which was very much appreciated. The Riad is traditional Moroccan at its best our room had its own private balcony overlooking the pool which was beautiful. The location was excellent a short 5 minute walk to Jamaa el fna square and situated in the traditional old town of Medina. I truly felt like a Princess staying here but still being able to embrace Marrakech life as a local. I would highly recommend Riad Nafis which will definitely not disappoint you. Thank you to all the staff at Marrackech's number one Riad for our perfect stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful staff, excellent location .. little hard to find though
Review_Text: This is wonderful quaint hotel only about 6 rooms in total so you get very personal service always with a smile and always pleasant..had a wonderful time there the rooms are all themed and have AC for heating/cooling.    Highly recommended.    It is however a little hard to find and only the street kids really know where it is. In case you need direction:    its on the back of the presidential palace if you ask where the hospital is and head that way you'll find an alleyway on your left where the palace ends and that's where you want to be. Walk down the alleyway then forks take a right and follow the alleyways round they will go right at an entrance to a house which is lower than st level after that the hotel will be at the next little opening on your left.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: A gorgeous riad with a lovely central pool and a balcony overlooking it. Our room was beautifully decorated and very relaxing. Breakfast on the roof terrace meant spectacular views of the Atlas mountains and nearby nesting storks. Homecooked dinner was fabulous too. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable arranged airport transfers for us and even ensured we didn't get lost en route to dinner.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Thank you to the entire staff at Nafis for making our stay there unforgettable. It was our first time in Marrakech we absolutely loved every minute of it. To be able to come back to the quite of the riad was priceless. There is no question in my mind that we will be back to continue to explore this fascinating country and again there is no doubt that this Riad will be where we will be staying.  Thank you to all of you and a happy new year.  Henriette and Wade
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Claire T wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Text: We stayed at the Riad Nafis for the first weekend in December and what can I say it was just lovely. When we arrived we were met and escorted to the Riad once we we arrived we were made to feel very welcome and offered tea and pastries such a lovely relaxing start to our stay.    When you walk through that door it is like a hidden treasure with its quaint and morrocan decor. The rooms are all great and have their own individual unique style. The service is exceptional you couldn't feel more at home and definitely get well looked after.    I would definitely recommend a stay at the Riad Nafis if you want something central to the main square and would like to experience a typical Morrocan style accommodation.    Thank you again to all the staff that made our stay amazing.    Claire and Gary Thompson x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent 3 nights in Riad Nafis and despite some misgivings about its surroundings when we arrived our stay proved to be almost perfect. The quaint and exotic decor was restful to the spirit and the beds were comfortable for the body. The staff could not have been more helpful or attentive.    A thoroughly enjoyable experience and one which we have no hesitation in recommending.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Excellent riad with superb service and great food
Review_Text: At the time of writing this review TripAdvisor holds 65 reviews rating the Riad Nafis as excellent and 6 as very good (that‚Äôs 71 out of a total of 74). The Hotels.com reviewers‚Äô rating is an average of 4.9 out of 5. That sets the expectations of anyone who may wish to stay at the riad a challenging level for the staff to maintain.    This review adds to the excellent ratings.    However we think it helpful to qualify those expectations and hopefully help the riad to maintain its high ratings. This is a traditional riad situated down a set of narrow pedestrian streets (derbs)‚Äì you will not find it by chance. Do not expect a view from your bedroom window or gardens to walk in or somewhere close to park a car. The five guest rooms are all different. We had the Beldi ‚Äì a delightful room full of character but long and narrow. That meant the double bed was quite small (no room for one larger). The marble/stone top holding the sink was a bit longer than ideal encroaching a little on the toilet. The room had a balcony overlooking the pool. We didn‚Äôt really have an issue with the quirkiness ‚Äì it all added to the charm and the room was beautifully decorated. However you might find one of the other larger rooms more to your liking. I do have one small criticism though; there was not enough light in the bathroom and shaving was a bit of guesswork. That‚Äôs something that does need to be addressed.    Having booked through Hotels.com our experience with the riad started with email exchanges with Laurent in which we booked a taxi from the airport requested dinner (one vegetarian) on the first night and ‚Äòdiscussed‚Äô possible day trips. Our flight to Marrakech arrived 40 minutes early so we reasonably expected to have to wait for the arranged taxi. But the driver was waiting when we came through from arrivals. We were impressed. He then took us directly to the riad parking as close as possible and helping to take our luggage to the front door ‚Äì he could have just pointed us in the right direction which we are sure is what would have happened if we‚Äôd just taken a taxi on our own. Impressed again.    We were welcomed by Rachid who marked up a tourist map explaining the key sights whilst we were served mint tea and delicious Moroccan pastries on the roof terrace. Introductions complete our luggage was in our room. When we were ready to start exploring Marrakech Rachid took us out through the derbs pointing out the landmarks we should use to find our way back. Impressed yet again.    When it came to dinner given there are only 5 rooms in the riad we rather expected our request for one vegetarian meal to result in two. But no. We were both served different main courses. All the food was beautifully presented and delivered and very tasty. Service was impeccable. What was so nice about the food was the way the ingredients of each course were explained the obvious pride everyone took in Moroccan food and their desire to delight us. And they did. We ate there a second time during our stay and the food and service were impeccable again. We admire their dedication hard work and their achievements. Well done everyone!    Breakfast consisted of freshly squeezed orange juice three kinds of pancakes three choices of jams (all great!) vanilla yoghurt and Moroccan or French bread with tea or coffee which we ate each day on the roof terrace. It didn‚Äôt seem to matter what time we ate. Service was again first rate. However it was exactly the same breakfast every day and by our fifth day we would have liked something a bit different. Come on guys with all that lovely fruit in Marrakech how about some fresh fruit at breakfast?    Whilst staying we also had some considerable help from Laurent and Rachid especially with planning our day trip to the Atlas mountains which was absolutely great. On leaving the riad Rachid presented us with the forms required at the airport for departure completed on our behalf (impressed yet again!) and Laurent and Rachid insisted on carrying our bags through the derbs to the taxi which delivered us back to the airport.    The riad is conveniently located about 15 minutes leisurely walk to Place Jemaa el Fna with other sights such as the El-Badia and El-Bahia palaces and the Saadians tombs even closer. A taxi ride to the Majorelle gardens cost us 32 dirham.    So in summary the Riad Nafis provided us with a comfortable quiet clean convenient location with top class service and excellent food and a real Moroccan experience rather than some 4*+ plastic large hotel which could be anywhere in the world. What more could one want?
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad & staff were great but I pre arranged airport transfer with the Riad and the guy was 40 minutes late. I booked it to avoid stress & hassle on arrival and to find the Riad. We came out of arrivals and there were 25 signs for Riads but not ours went round all the signs twice - nothing waited 5 minutes and realised I would have to get a taxi so had to get currency long queue so left wife and went back to check again - still no sign eventually got currency and as a last thought on way out went back for last time and the so & so had turned up. Stayed at Riads Nafis & Al Badia both have same owner and both excellent but would never book again as I don't need the hassle & stress on arrival.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An absolutely wonderful place to stay!
Review_Text: We definitely recommend - From the mesmerising Riad to the so very nice staff at Riad Nafis we had such a lovely experience in Marrakech. Located in the Old City in a residential area where you can experience 'real' Marrakech. A short walk to the main square and Souks. Lovely view of the Koutoubia Mosque. A part from the beautiful room and relaxing terrace and swimming pool the best part of our stay at Riad Nafis was Rashid and the staff. Helpful polite and genuinely very nice people!

Review_Date: Sabia C wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: I loved my stay in this little B&B in Marrakech Morocco. This place is very clean nice and has a great set up. The staff was very polite attentive and efficient. Their breakfast was really really good. And they used fresh ingredients to cook my lunch. The food was 10x better then other 5 star hotels that I have stayed. My stay in this place assisted me greatly to deal with the craziness of Marrakech. I highly recommend this place for anyone who dares to venture into Marrakech Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Michael D wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Text: While I exaggerate somewhat about the "madness" of Marrakesh it is definitely true that the Riad Nafis was a welcome change from the hustle and bustle of a MUCH busier medina than the medina in Fes or Meknes. The manager and staff were extremely friendly and the facility itself was brilliant. The plunge pool in the middle of the Riad was beatiful and the terrace was great. Ideally located within the medina the Riad is minutes away from everything. We especially liked it's closeness to a phenomenal massage and spa called Le Bains de Marrakesh...not to be missed especially after our battle royales in the soukhs and the Jmaa al-Fina. We definitely recommend this location if staying in the city. Our only regret was that we were there only one night. We spent a few nights at Le Meridien and after our stay at Riad Nafis we wish the terms of stay were reversed...A spectacular notch above any main-stay resorts.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: chris L wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: what a truly amazing Riad..    After reading other peoples reviews you wonder if this can be so true... but honestly the riad nafis is everything and more the review from J M Cunningham is exactly as it was.  There was nothing that we could fault and that means a lot when you choose a place to stay on holiday.  special thanks to Rashid for making everything so perfect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I booked a room at the riad for my wife's 30th birthday on the previous reviews and can say that they were NOT wrong. The service and the staff were all perfect. We arranged a transfer via the riad and were taken into the riad by the driver. Upon entry and completion of some paperwork Mr Laurent sat down and went through the map on places to visit and excursions avaiable. In this time we were serviced pastries and mint tea. We were offered to be taken round town. We strolled the souks and the medina and what an experience. The food was lovely and cheap and the medina was within 10 minutes walk from the riad. We had a wondeful few days. The room was clean and the service was of a 5 star hotel. We arranged a transfer back and again were taken from the riad and to the airport. Mr Laurent was going to meet us but due to his car breaking down he called to say goodbye.  I would recommend this to anyone who wants a personal service and a pleasent peaceful stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a true delight in the midst of mayhem In Marrakech! The service impeccable every wish was always their pleasure. The riad was peaceful and comfortable the rooms relaxed with that unmistakable exotic Morroccan decor. The food sumptuous having dinner at sundown on the rooftop overlooking the medina was such a great suggestion from Laurent. We unwound from the days travel sipped a marvelous morrocan red wine dined on Morroccan delicacies and watched the storks on the nearby Koutoubia minaret. I was just waiting for them to say cut it was a scene from the movies! Do yourself a favor and use the pickup service from the airport or train station you'll know why once you get there! Also the guide that was hired thru the riad Mousaffa was absolutely the best his English - flawless and his love and knowledge of Marrakech and Morrocco was easily absorbed and aided our new interest for this enigmatic city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Entrance into Riad Nafis is a transitional experience from the busy M√©dina - it is truly a tranquil place! The inner courtyard is a jewel.     We enjoyed our stay for 10 nights residing in the Junior Suite which was a bohemian mix of furniture dream like and romantically decorated including a draped fourposter bed.  Breakfast each day was plentiful.  When we dined in the meal was very good and reasonably priced.    Our stay in Marrakech was actually a surprise gift from myself to my partner.  On the day of his birthday after dining at the Riad we found in our room a surprise gift  from all the staff - a bottle of wine and birthday poem awaiting our return.    All at the Riad were so nice and accommodating.  When we visit Marrakech we will stay again in this beautiful Riad!    Once again thank you all (Na√Øma Najat Karima Hicham Rachid & Laurent) for your hospitality x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Julia C wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Title: A gorgeous, serene island of hospitality and excellent food in a bustling city.
Review_Text: My husband (!!) and I just finished our amazing honeymoon where we spent most of one week in Marrakech and staying at Riad Nafis. I have never experienced such amazing and warm hospitality in my life before. The staff here are extremely open and friendly and take such pride in their work! Truly they are all the heart and soul of this place. Our vacation was a success through their help and advice from the moment we arrived being greeted by mint tea home made pastries and being provided with a city map as well as a quick tutorial on what to expect and how to get by in this new city and foreign culture! They truly want you to feel at home in the Riad. And this spirit lasted through even our last moments in Marrakech.    The atmosphere is relaxed and serene immaculately clean and the interior is truly Moroccan chic! Amenities include a beautiful rooftop terrace with a sun-bathing area and a canopied area that is beautiful for taking in fresh air and particularly nice in the evening when you can watch nearby stork nests and listen to the beautiful calls to prayer from the city mosques. There is a wonderfully refreshing pool in the inner courtyard area as well - always welcome after long hot days traversing the myriad of souks and historical sites of the city! Additionally the bed rooms have air conditioning available which makes sleep comfortable durin the hot months (for us temperatures were in the 40s C)    And finally the piece that never escapes my notice the food. The chef at the Riad is a precious resource! Breakfast made new every morning ready whenever you wake up. Moroccan breakfast foods are on the sweet (but not overly sweet) side. Always something fresh made and new bountiful and very filling. We often did not need lunch afterwards. You also have the option of having the Riad prepare a 3 course dinner for you for a modest price which I highly recommend you do at least once! We did this on our last night in Marrakech and it was the best meal of the whole trip!    We'll be telling all of our friends and family about it but I'll tell you too - you cannot go wrong by staying at Riad Nafis!  All the best  Julia and Michael

Review_Date: jean-marc s wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: I cannot speak highly enough of the welcome and service we received from LaurentYussef and all the staff at Riad Nafis. Always available nothing was too much trouble.  Laurent did organize our airport transfer (recommended on 1st time).  As soon as we entered the riad we were greated by Youssef who sat with us we were served mint tea and delicious home made pastries. Yussef provided us with the all information about Marrakech he shown us on the map the places to visit restaurants 1 day trips away from Marrakech enough to make you feel confortable to approach such a different culture and enjoy the best of the destination.  We had the Sultana Junior Suite which is located on first floor overlooking the fabulous swimming pool patio. It was furnished with lots of delicacy in details very clean air-conditioned and the queen size double-bed was comfortable.  The Riad is a subtile mixture of traditionnal Moroccan decoration with contemporary art from a local Artist we loved the sublime bust of woman ! Free Wi-Fi is also available in the Riad.  We had tasty breakfasts every morning on the top floor terrace overlooking the koutoubia and we had dinner on our first evening.  This was our best meal in Marrakech. We can not recommend more highly to anyone staying here to have at least 1 dinner at the riad.  All is homemade with fresh vegetables from the market so you need to book ahead Na√Øma prepared for us a delightful assortments of Moroccan salads with verrine a tasty tajine and refreshing dessert.  In resume great hotel service with personnal attentions We recommend to anyone visiting Marrakech to stay at Riad Nafis we definitely will be back soon !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We are just coming back from a 5 nights stay at Riad Nafis we can just say what was already said on this site just a fabulous experience !  When looking for a riad we decided to book Riad Nafis on the strength of the great reviews on this site.  The all staff is just amazing they went out of their way to make sure that our all stay at the riad and in Marrakech was going perfectly.  From the breakfast in the morning on the beautifull sunny terrasse to the late evening in the air conditionned lounge overlooking the swimming-pool everything is made to make you relax and enjoy this discreet but very efficient hospitality nothing is too much trouble no time to wake-up to have breakfast or dinner  We stayed in the Berbere standard room on 1st floor quiet and large enough. The all riad is stylishly decorated and spotlessly clean.  Located at 5 minutes walk from Jema El Fna Square this is an excellent location.  Thank you Laurent Youssef and your all team for having made us feel home you really made our stay in Marrakech fabulous
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Best location clean perfect service and staff. The owner know how to conduct a five stars hotel. If you go to marrakech this is the place. 5 minutes from the square large and comfortable room e a roof top that has a view to all city. If i come back to marrakech this will be my place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Divine Service in the Middle of Marrakech
Review_Text: Na√Øma Najat Karima Hicham Youssef & Laurent made our stay perfect in every way. Riad Nafis is at the end of a charming ally away from the noise of the city. From the moment we arrived to our 4:30 am departure we were provided with excellent service and advice directions and made to feel at home. Laurent arranged for my dream cooking class a day trip to Essaouira with an excellent driver and made my chef dreams come true by setting up dinner reservations at all of the restaurants on my wish list. The Hammam that Riad Nafis suggested was excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Being our first trip to Morocco we we‚Äôre encouraged by the great reviews of this place. Nothing could be further from the truth. Our three person party was greeted at the door by Yousef the hotel manager who informed us that because our reservation listed 2 people we would not be able to put 3 people into a room. Mind you on our reservation listed 2 people (plus one cot). A logical person reading that would have assumed that there should be a bed for two people plus a cot for another. Instead we were told that the only way to stay in the hotel would be to rent another room for one person for another 90 Euros! The hotel owner Laurent came and we went back and forth. At one point they pretended to call another hotel to see if they had openings. Not surprisingly there was no answer. If it had been any other country we would have been able to simply leave and find another hotel but in Marrakech the hotels are not easy to locate and we did not speak the language. Laurent and Yousef knew this and we were handcuffed to the Nafis. We had no choice but to pay the 90 Euros for both nights (180 extra Euros for nothing ($252)! But that robbery wasn‚Äôt enough to quench their greed. They went on to cheat us on every transaction we made with them. Every bill was filled with extra charges and over conversions. They were determined to steal everything we had and it made our stay miserable. There is no reputable hotel in any corner of the world that would treat its customers like that. If you want to travel to Marrakech I recommend not staying long. If you do DO NOT STAY AT THE NAFIS! If you find yourself there bring your calculator with you at check out time. I promise there will be some interesting math on your final bill.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Dianne V wrote a review May 2012
Review_Title: This Riad was the highlight of our trip
Review_Text: Through careful research on Tripadvisor we were led to this Riad in the Medina and couldn't have been more pleased. The staff were so caring and attentive to our every need. How pleasant to come back to this place each day after the chaos of negotiating through the souks and traffic of Marrakech. I came for both work and pleasure so our stay here was longer than average--8 nights. Our 8 year old son fell in love with Morocco and this Riad and staff in particular and can't wait to come back. We'll definitely book again here when we come back to visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: cate j wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Title: peace and quiet and excellent food.
Review_Text: My sister and I stayed in the Riad Nafis for 3 nights. We wanted a city break with the chance of some sunshine and culture. Marrakech is everything you want it to be and more. All your senses are attacked from all angles! The Riad Nafis is a great place to take a respite from the crowds and noise.  Location: It's a 10 minute walk from the main square in one direction and the Tombs and palaces in the other. Located next to the Royal Palace walls means there are palace guards about 24 hours so it's really safe day and night. Yousef gave us maps and a guided walk to the main road on arrival so we knew exactly where we were going.  Rooms: We had the twin on the ground floor right next to the pool. All the rooms looked amazing and unique. We found ours a little dark as there are no windows and lamps were subtle!! All the furnishings are 5star - beautiful lamps rugs wooded wardrobes and inlayed doors. The bathroom was fantastic power shower loads of hot water hair dryer big towels nice smellies etc. We had thick lovely duvets for the colder nights and crisp white sheets.  A bottle of water was provided in our room on arrival plus mosquito coils (never needed) and wifi login.  Be aware there are no locks on doors but security is tight and no one is allowed into the Riad except guests.  Facilities: There is a lounge area next to the pool where you can eat and lounge and play music read watch swimmers. No TV of any sort anywhere!!  The sun terrace on the roof has sun hats and towels providedon loungers and lovely sun beds.  Food/drink: There are no coffee/ tea making facilities and no bar - but you can ask for whatever you want from the 24 hour staff. We are big wine drinkers and tried the house(Morrocan) rose and white - both were excellent and around 12Euros a bottle.  Breakfast - was amazing - like everything in Morrocco it appeals to the sweet toothed! But all I will say is that we never needed lunch! There was always more than enough to eat and fabulous orange juice and coffee. Each day we had slightly different things which I thought was fab.You can choose where you ate (terrace or lounge or room) and can have it any time you want to!  Dinner - we ate dinner twice. I wont spoil it but gorgeous tagines and lots of local ingredients. 18Euros for 3 courses plus coffee. reasonable for what you get. All very filling!  Swimming pool - wow it's beautiful. It is not heated so not for the faint hearted.    Other stuff: Mint tea and pastries on arrival. Fabulously helpful staff (Yousef and Laurent are both wonderful) Nothing is forced on you yet they always seemed to be there if we needed something. They organised taxis from/ to airport worth doing if only so you dont get lost.  Gave us umbrellas when it rained.    I would definitely stay here again. It's peaceful and stress free and close enough to everything you need to see.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed in the Riad Nafis in March and were well taken care of. Behind an old carved door is a modern reception area that opens on to a pool open to the stars in warm weather. The 5 bedrooms look out on to the central open area. The rooms are nice sized comfortable beds. The bathrooms were luxurious. We had breakfast outside on the rooftop terrace a delicious mix of the best that Moroccan and French can offer.  We ended up at Riad Nafis by accident. Due to a computer glitch our original reservation at a different riad was overbooked. The manager knew we would be arriving late in the day to Marrakesh and re-booked our 2 rooms at the Nafis. So we were doubly lucky and thankful that they had looked out for us in this way.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Wonderful wonderful wonderful! My sister and I have just returned from Riad Nafis and the location is great all of the staff at Nafis are exceptional and the breakfast is the best I have ever had! The price reflects the reasonable accommodation this is not top end but the service is extraordinary. Thank you Yusef and the lovely people around you your attention and care was greatly appreciated.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: One of my favorite hotels in the world
Review_Text: I travel a lot and have a list of my favorite hotels... Riad Nafis easily makes it in to my top 3. The property is beautiful and the staff are the most friendly and accommodating I've ever encountered.    Breakfast is wonderful and served on the roof top terrace each morning. After a cold winter it was nice to sit outside and soak in the sunshine while enjoying the fresh squeezed orange juice and homemade breads and jams. Breakfast is served whenever you wake up which was a nice treat for my group since we slept in until 10am the first morning.    We choose to have dinner at the Riad 2 nights. Both meals were wonderful and it was a treat to eat in the common area enjoy wine and not have to worry about walking back late at night in the dark. (Although the neighborhood always seemed very safe.)    I suggest booking transportation to/from the hotel through the hotel. It was very reasonably priced and I can't imagine how difficult it would be to get there without someone who knew the way.    The bedrooms are beautiful and comfortable. The hotel is truly magical from the open floor plan looking down to a swimming pool (often with floating rose petals) to the warm common area/sitting room.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed in this charming traditional courtyard house for a week at the beginning of February. This small hotel (5 rooms) is clean comfortable and has as many staff as rooms although you don't feel hassled but they really look after you and even taught my husband to make the traditional mint tea. Yusef arranged a car and driver to take us to see the women's argan oil co-operative and Essouria about two hours away on the coast. The trip (and the hotel) were very reasonably priced and having our own driver meant that we were able to stop when and where we wanted. We had arranged to be met at the airport as I was concerned that we may not find the hotel in the unmarked streets of the old medina and I would reccomend this option as it is not much more than getting a taxi from the airport and the driver takes you to the door of the Riad. When we first went out Yusef walked with us making sure we knew how to find our way back and showing us how to get to Jma el Fnaa a few minutes walk from the hotel. Breakfast was served on the roof terrace but you can have it served inside if the weather is too cold which it was on a couple of days but then you miss watching the storks on the nearby mosque and the eagles soaring overhead. We also had dinner in the hotel twice you have to order this in advance as they then buy the ingredients that day. When you arrive you are told to treat the hotel as your home and that breakfast is served when you want it this certainly was true for us. I would certainly stay here again and would thoroughly recommend it for anyone considering visiting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Roxana R wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Text: This riad was beautiful and the staff made our stay even more enjoyable.They were extremely welcoming and went out of their way to make sure we were as comfortable as we could be. I felt sick one morning they really looked after me made me some thyme and cumin tea to take with me for the day and I felt better in no time!    The riad was clean and in a great location five-ten minutes walk to the square and other attractions. There are a couple of alleys you have to walk through to get to the riad but it is located near one of the palaces so guards and police were constantly roaming this area and we felt very safe.    Although it was such a beautiful riad what made it so much more special were the excellent staff (in particular Youssef the riad manager) nothing was too much trouble. I plan to return here it's great value for money I felt the staff really did become our family during our stay and I highly recommened it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Jonathon P wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Text: Me and girlfriend stayed at Riad Nafis for 6 nights and have never felt so relaxed and taken care of. The breakfasts were very good and served whenever we got up (closer to lunchtime). The staff all introduced themselves and nothing was ever too much to ask. The Riad is decorated in beautifully and from the roof terrance you have a brilliant view of the Atlas mountains. Location was excellent and we walked to all of the main tourist attraction.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Nafis and would definitely recommend to others.  The staff were so helpful and friendly and the food was amazing- we ate in on the first evening and had a lovely tagine and breakfasts were all home made.  The location of the riad was perfect as we could walk to all the main sights easily.  Rooms were really nice and unique. The only suggestions I would say to improve the rooms would perhaps be to provide bath robes and a stand up shower.  We really enjoyed our stay and felt like it was a home away from home. Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Victoria K wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Text: I stayed at the Riad Nafis for four nights from 10th November to 14th November 2011 and all I can sya is what a wonderful place it is to stay. It's a little daunting as you walk down the alleyways on your arrival to the Riad but once you step inside it is like walking into a beautiful centre of calm in a busy bustling city. The Riad is beautifully decorated with 5 bedrooms a swimming pool (though it was too cold to use it on our visit) a lounge/dining area and a roof terrace.    Altogether the Riad Nafis was a wonderful place to stay. It is ideally located right next to the Royal Residence in the Medina (old town) within easy walking distance of everything in Marracech. A huge delicioud breakfast is served daily on the roof terrace with great views of the city and the Atlas Mountains. We ate at the Riad for 2 nights and the food was as good as in the expensive restaurants in town.    Upon arrival we were greeted by Laurent the Riad owner. He sat down with us and gave us an incredibly informative and useful guide of the city and told us all the most interesting places to go and how to get there. He was also wonderfully helpful and booked all of our excursions for us and explained which were the best places to visit.    All of the staff were incredibly helpful and they all went out of their way to be kind and helpful to us. We went for a balloon ride on our final morning and had to leave the hotel at 5.30am so Hisham the night staff made breakfast especially for us at 5am and then walked with us to our pick up point to make sure we go to the taxi ok. Ahmed the Riad Manager was also very lovely and helpful and walked our cases to the taxi to take us back to the airport.    I would definitely recommend Riad Nafis to anyone who is looking for somewhere to stay in Marrakech. It is a traditional Riad in an ideal location with lovely staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Joep C wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Text: Stayed at Riad Nafis for 5 nights and it was absolutely great! Perfect room (Mogador) very clean excellent service staff is so friendly and makes you feel so welcome!    Location in Marrakech is perfect. Unfortunately we had some rain and low temperatures but than we stayed in the Riad by the fire place with a bottle of red Moroccan wine and easy listening music...absolutely lovely!    i can really recommend this!!    Joep
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Tranquil Riad close to the madness of Marakesh
Review_Text: As the title says this is a great find  close to everything.  Perfect for the city break. Stayed for 5 nights staff fantastic room great. They will organise tours restaurants .  Use the airport pick up well worth while
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We recently spent a week at Riad Nafis. We couldn't have been happier with our choice of accommodation. It was ideally located just 10 mins walk from the main square. The team were so friendly and could not have been more helpful always making sure we were comfortable and had any info we needed. Our room was clean comfortable spacious and beautifully decorated. We had breakfast at our leisure on the roof every day under the gazebo before heading out to the sights. We also had dinner at the riad a couple of times which was excellent. I would 100% recommend Riad Nafis to anyone visiting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I returned from our first child-free holiday in 5 years feeling relaxed and refreshed after four nights in this beautiful riad. We arranged taxi collection from the airport which was the smoothest transfer we have ever had and I doubt we would have found the hotel without this service. We agree with all the comments from the other guests the service is obviously consistently good. We'll be recommending it to others which we don't normally do.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Myself and a friend just came back from Riad Nafis and had a wonderful time. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and even let us use the computer when we had problems with our own. The breakfast was very pleasant on the roof terrace and the roof terrace was very peaceful to come back to after a day at the souks. The swimming pool although quite small was very refreshing. The main square is only about a ten minute walk which was great and the kasbah was only about 10 mins too so overall an excellent location. Do take earplugs if youre a light sleeper as the mosque prayers will wake you otherwise but overall we had a great time there and will be returning!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: moira a wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Title: Fantastic, faultless, can't wait to return
Review_Text: My friend and I returned from a 5 day stay at Riad Nafis 2 days ago. It was a blissful and enchanting experience made as such by the wonderful young team of staff there. I cannot praise them enough as the service and attention provided by them all was second to none. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel welcome and told to treat the riad as our home. We were given valuable information on where to visit and personally guided out to the main road by Mahdi the manager on our first evening there. The breakfasts were delicious as was the evening meal we had arranged after one long day in the souks. The location of Riad Nafis is also perfect a mere 10 minute walk to Jemma el Fna and infinitely preferable to the large modern hotels in the new town. The entrance appears wanting on arrival but before long we looked forward to the walk through the alleyways and past the familiar locals and traders all of whom were helpful and respectful at all times. Riad Nafis is a beautiful oasis of calm after the hot and busy outside world with delightful areas in which to relax or sunbathe. The accommodation was spotlessly clean as was the pool sprinkled with rose petals. I cannot recommend this place enough and can't wait to make a return visit myself. Moira Antoniou
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I just got back from 3 days in Marrakech and without a doubt this Riad was my favorite part of the trip. It was a beautiful oasis from the hectic life of this crazy city. Mahdi was very helpful in recommending excursions and restaurants and everyone else was very helpful and friendly. I loved the fact that it was hidden back in the neighborhood and was part of the history of this great city. Having said that I would recommend at least having them pick you up from the airport because you will not find it without help. Awesome
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: A tranquil home away from home
Review_Text: What a wonderful Riad: calm tranquil and beautiful. The staff were helpful and attentive but not intrusive.  We were made to feel completely welcome and at home from the minute we arrived.  Breakfast was lovely and served whenever you wanted on the sun terrace.  Our room was beautiful (fully air conditioned) and it was serviced whilst we had breakfast.  Drinks were available 24/7 and served wherever we wanted.  Advice was readily given and trips were organised at our request with ease and efficency.  We requested the transfer too and from the airport: this was a really worthwhile service as the Riad manager met us from the taxi to direct us to the Riad.  The sun terrace has a wonderful view over the city with sun loungers towels and hats provided.  The plunge pool was brilliant and a heaven-sent in 40 degree heat.  I cannot reccommend this Riad highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Five star accomodation with friendly helpfull staff
Review_Text: We booked four days at the Riad Nafis April 12 - 15th 2011. Staff couldnt do enough to help us clean rooms very welcoming excellent value for money.  When we arrived we were greeted by Mehete and Karima who made us mint tea and we sat on the sun roof terrace overlooking Marakech. Mehete's personal maps and advice to go during the day and evening was really helpfull. Breakfast on the sunroof every morning with freshly made orange juice was lovely.    We ate in the Riad Nafis on the first night and it was really nice and just as good as the expensive resturants we tried.  Our room was very clean and comfortable and had a morrocon theme.    Short walk to main square we really enjoyed our stay in Marakech and would definetly come back to the Riad Nafis it made our stay really enjoyable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tracy S wrote a review Jan 2011
Review_Text: Very welcoming and friendly staff. Excellent meal on arrival - we just asked them to "make sometihng" and couldn't fault the meal served on the rooftop terrace. Very comfortable but unfortunately our room looked out onto an alley and peoplepassed from very early in the morning disturbing us somewhat. The bathroom was big and luxurious with a roll top bath but a shower on the wall would have been appreciated - however the shower in our children's room was excellent.  The staff were very attentive and a very good breakfast was served on the roof. We asked advice on restaurants they were booked for us and the recommendation was spot on.  Some of this sounds a bit negative but they were small points which didn't detract from this place being very good overall
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I have just got back from Marrakech with my friend and had to write a wee review about this wonderful oasis! We spent 2 nights 23rd and 24th of December and I must say I have worked and stayed all over the world but nothing compares to the excellent attention to detail the staff esp Rashed and Lauren ( perfect hosts) and the food was totally authentic and very tasty. We even managed a 2nd visit whilst in Marrakech for dinner the food was so good and the continuity remained. All we can say is well done to the team at Nafis! you made us both feel so welcome almost like family and nothing was too much trouble. We will be recommending you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We spent a wonderful week in Riad Nafis and we had an unforgettable time in this beautiful little oasis in a very good location in the medina close to many sightseeing spots . Everyone of the staff was really outstanding and so helpful that every whish was taken care of. Breakfast and dinner were very good and more tasteful than in many high priced restaurants that often are rather tourist traps.  The hotel is easy to find close to one of the king's residences. The neighborhood is very friendly and welcoming where you will always feel safe. By foot you are quickly at Jamaa El-Fna and also close to main streets where you can take taxis to go to Gueliz or so.  When we come back to Marrakesh we will certainly try to come back to Riad Nafis. We would recommend everyone to stay there instead of staying in one of the more big hotels in the modern part of the town. You will simply make a different experience that the modern part cannot match and again... such a nice staff you won't find easily again thank you Shukran!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A Great Base to enjoy the Medina
Review_Text: We were a bit anxious about taking our infant daughter to a Riad - after all they are supposed to be places of calm! However our fears were soon put aside by the wonderful welcome from the owners and staff who had provided a sumptious room complete with a huge bath and top-notch baby cot. We really did feel like we had a team of caring experts on hand while staying at Nafis - advice fabulous service tasty food wi-fi even offers of babysitting - nothing was too much trouble.  The Riad is perfectly placed towards the perimeter of the medina to allow a casual 10 minutes walk into the central square and we found it easy to walk back when the day heated up for a siesta or lounge on the roof terrace with mint tea. Nafis represents extremely good value for money and with only 5 rooms had a great European vibe with a cosmopolitan mix of guests. We recommend it whole-heartedly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My wife and I stayed here for our 25th wedding anniversary which also coincided with her 50th birthday so we obviously wanted something special. We were not disappointed. All the rooms are beautifully decorated. The breakfasts on the roof terrace excellent. And if you decide to take advantage of the evening meals they are of high quality authentic Moroccan cuisine and very good value.    The staff were very helpful and attentive and the French owners are often on hand to recommend places to visit etc.    Perfectly situated to visit most of the major sites I would certainly not hesitate in recommending this Riad to anybody looking for a small Riad with a warm friendly and relaxed atmosphere.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed at the Riad Nafis for 3 nights and it was perfect. We prebooked transfers with the Riad in advance which I would really recommend as it would be hard to find if you purely got a taxi from the airpot. Friendly staff great breakfast on the terrace and a much appreciated plunge pool after a hot days exploring. Very central to the hustle and bustle the Riad is beautifully decorated and the service was great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: First time in Marrakech and could not recommend Riad Nafis highly enough. Herve and Catherine have a truly wonderful Riad with a fantastic team who are so friendly and provide such a high level of service - it would make many hotel chains blush. Many thanks to Rasheed and Karima who went out of their way to make sure our stay was perfect. Would return in a second. Ten minutes walk from La Katoubia - in the heart of the Medina & great location. If you are going to Marrakech stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Lovely owners and excellent staff. Food was great and it is beautifully decorated. You would be very hard pressed to find anything wrong with this place. Possibly a little far from the centre of things BUT.......it also means a nice break from the crowds and craziness although not the traffic until you get into the laneways properly.    Highly recommended. Would not hesitate to return at any time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: First trip for my GF & I in Marakesh. The service is top notch and they really go out of their way to take care of their guests. They even provided us with a local guide after we specified what we were looking for. Her name was Valerie and she was so delightful and made our trip so much better. You need a guide if you've never been to Marakesh before or you don't speak French.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: a great place to stay in marrakech!
Review_Text: If you are looking for a safe well situated clean nicely decorated place to stay go for riad nafis!  We stayed here in march 2010 and were very inpressed by the owners and staff.  So warm friendly and caring.  Imagine waking up having a great breakfast on a roof terrace overviewing Marrakech listening to birds singing.  After a full day in the city or the mountains come back home have a drink or a swim stay in the riad for dinner or check out all the restaurants in the city.  The owner guides you with a lot of info maps reservations touristic info.  We took a private driver up into the mountains had tea with the berbers it was great.  We would like to recommend this hotel to all travelers to Marrakech Enjoy!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I booked this Riad after reading the previous reviews and having purchased flights already. It was a short fifteen minute drive from the airport and the transfer was reasonably priced and arranged by the Riads owners. It is located just inside the main walls and borders one of the kings palaces. The location is ideal close enough to the main square and sights but far enough away to be a quiet peaceful relaxation space    The Riad is beautiful an absolute gem that makes you feel instantly at home. There is a central bathing pool and the rooms are on two levels above it. The roof contains sun longers and a beautiful little gazebo that is perfect for a drink in the evening whilst the sun goes down    My room was individually decorated with beautiful hand picked and designed furniture and fittings (the owner is a graphic desifgner who hand drew what she wanted and commissioned local artisans to produce) and the bathroom contained a shower room. It was very clean well kept and the staff were very attentive.    I cannot praise the staff enough they treat you individually and are there for anything at all you may need. They have a dedicated night staff member which means it is staffed 24 hours a day    All in all this has been the best stay in a hotel/riad i have experienced in many years and cannot wait to go back. I would reccomend the riad to solo travellers and couples as there are only five rooms and it makes it a very tailored experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: After being picked up from the airport I was a little dubious about being taken several dim winding allies to an unmarked front door. However inside the Riad is beutifully decorated with modern comfertable fixtures. The owner gave us the lowdown on Marrakech with some ideas on what to see and eat.    The staff are fantastic always on hand to help . The swimming pool was a little chilly in January but I am sure lovely in summer. The roof terrace has great view over Marrakech to the mountains where you can have breakfast (very tasty) or lounge on the chairs in the sun. Also just a short walk from all the sites in the Medina.    Will be staying again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A truly authentic experience of Marrakech
Review_Text: A truly authentic experience of Marrakech. The hosts and staff were like long lost friends. Fresh breakfast was served each morning on the terrace and it's worth booking a meal in the riad. The hosts arranged airport transfers for us and had dinner prepared for us which made our arrival hassle free this was also a great intro to Moroccan cuisine.    Aileen Scotland
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for 3 nights last July and would not hesitate to return. It is a beautiful family-run riad and the elegant rooms are spotless and spacious. It felt very authentic as it is hidden in a warren of little streets but an easy 5 minute walk to the souks.  As described Mohammed the night guard and the whole staff were absolutely lovely and we felt at home instantly. Catherine was a gracious and involved host.  Overall the riad was excellent value and for us much preferable to an anonymous hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We've stayed our first two days in Morocco in Riad Nafis. And what a good place to start!! Nice rooms a great terrrace overlooking Marrakech (with lounge area) and a good pool.....Most outstanding were the stories with the guardian. Although we had a language problem (our french wasn't really great:-() we really had nice conversations with this great man!    When we visit Marrakech again it will be sure at Riad Nafis!    Thanks Again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: You can't go wrong with Riad Nafis
Review_Text: Riad Nafis feels like home from the first moment you step in as you are welcomed by the super-friendly staff. The owners are very helpful and are present at the Riad everyday. They seem to treat the place as 'home' and a big family. The three girls are all very nice and wonderful cooks. One of them Karima does the beautiful henna tatoos in the convenience of the riad lounge.  The rooms are traditionally decorated without compromising your comfort. The lounge and the terrace are wonderful for eating and chilling.  I also have to mention Mohammed the night guard who is one of the most friendly people I have ever met in a life time!  I stayed in Riad Nafis for 3 days in March 2009 and enjoyed very bit of it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in September 2008 and loved it. Herve picked us up from the airport and gave us an overview of the city on our way back to the riad we were greeted with tea and home made shortbread whilst he advised us of the main sites in Marrakech The Riad is about a 20 minute drive from the airport.    Riad Nafis is chic and elegant. We stayed in two different rooms the Sultana and the Berber and loved both.    Catherine Herve's wife has designed and decorated each room beutifully in collaboration with the local artisans. The attention to detail is superb. Each room has its own stylish elegance.    In the Sultana the fabrics were luxurious velvets with a gold gilt bathroom.    The Berber room used traditional design elements from the recycled cedar support posts to the arabic inscribed bedheads. The free standing clawfoot bathtub was a delight and the cool greens and blues lovely.    The beds in both rooms were very comfortable with the highest quality sheets and bedding.    The pool and loungeroom area are lovely places to chill out and the rooftop terrace affords superb views over Marrakech to the High Atlas. We spent many hours relaxing there.    The three girls who work at the Riad are beautifull and will accomodate you at all times. We were able to orgnise lunch only 1 hour after arriving during Ramadan !!. The girls made the best breakfast and the lunchtime Kofta was one of the best we had in 3 months of travel.    Mohammed the night guard is charming and will greet you like an old friend when you return each evening. When we had to get up early (5.30am) for the high Atlas and for our flight he woke us and tended to us serving breakfast and carrying our bags to the car !    Everyone at the Riad Nafis is friendly and extremely helpful. Catherine Herve and their staff felt like familiy by the time we left.    The Riad' is not in the Place Djemaa el Fna but it's only a short walk (5 mins) to all the major sites.    The Nafis was a sanctuary to return to after the chaos of the souks and the streets of Marrakech !    We could not recommend it enough and hope to return one day.    Neil and Trudi Wassell
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic! The ONLY place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: My mother and I arrived on the 21st October and were collected from the airport by owner Herve. He drove us back to the Riad giving us the Marrakech "overview" on the way.    The Riad is simply beautiful. Yes its tucked away down some back streets which initially look rather suspicious but they soon become familiar and the same faces will greet you happily each morning.    We stayed in the twin room on the ground floor. Lovely. Herve's wife has decorated the place wonderfully - the attention to detail is second to none.    Bathroom was spacious and spotlesss.    The three girls who work at the Riad are delightful and will try to accomodate you at all times. They love it when you try to speak French!    Mohammed the night guard is quite a character and will greet you like an old friend when you return in the evening.    Everyone at the Riad Nafis is friendly and SO helpful and knowledgable. When we arrived they sat with us for an hour and gave us information and advise which turned out to be invaluable.    OK so the Riad's not IN the Place Djemaa el Fna but it's a nice short walk away AND it's right next door to the Royal Palace.    We could not give a better review! Super!
